column1: <h2 style=""text-align: center
","Special offer for our final 48 HOURS!
Starting now (Wed., June 26 @ 9am EDT)...

IN ADDITION to the campaign perks currently available...1ST 10 BACKERS - GET & GIVE 3 YEARS Unlimited Extended Access*NEXT 20 BACKERS - GET & GIVE 1 YEAR Unlimited Extended Access** Applicable after our future platform subscription service begins
WANT TO MAKE THE WORLD A LESS STRESSFUL PLACE?
From a place of calm, openness & focus, we make better decisions, work smarter, & enjoy more. But we don’t always know how to get there on our own.
That's why we created Composure, a music & audio technology company creating immersive, fully-interactive sound experiences that:
Reduce stress & improve mood in minutes
Are built for the web (easy to access, easy to use)
Are mobile, desktop & VR compatible
ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN
Participating in our ""Get Calm. Give Calm."" campaign means you don't just become a supporter, you become part of our #CommunityofCalm. When you back us on Indiegogo...
You GET extended FREE access to our stress relieving platform*
We GIVE extended FREE access to someone in need**
*Full platform now and after Composure's paid subscription service begins
**Matching the same FREE access you receive!
CONTRIBUTE ANY AMOUNT, OR
CHECK OUT OUR PERKS FOR SPECIAL OFFERS
REAL IMPACT
Relieving stress can save a life!

Stress has been attributed to chronic health conditions & even death. Composure's unique approach uses music & sound that involves the listener as a powerful & effective way to find calm & focus within minutes!
Our #CommunityofCalm program delivers your GIFT of extended FREE access to our platform to improve mental and emotional wellbeing for:
trauma victims
first responders
veterans & their families
We have a range of recipients, but if there is someone in your life that you know would benefit from this GIFT, please alert us in the campaign comments section and we will be happy to accommodate!
ABOUT US
Music is the only art form that speaks directly to the heart without first being considered by the mind."" - Leonard Bernstein (paraphrased)
Music & sound have been used therapeutically for centuries. Composure is bringing it into the future.
We use leading-edge, WebXR technology to combine fully-interactive spatial audio with soothing, virtual environments for experiences you can enjoy anytime, anywhere.

So far, over 2,000 people in more than 45 countries have used our web app to help them manage their stress. Composure has already had a positive impact on people's lives...& we're just getting started!
Map of ""Prelude"" Global Users (Courtesy of geometric.datavized.com)
Prelude""

Composure's ""Prelude"" is a FREE, fully-interactive web app that reduces stress in less than 5 minutes! With a spacious virtual environment & interactive spatial sound, it's ""sole purpose is to create a space of peaceful recovery & self-exploration"" (UploadVR.com, Aug. 2018). It works right through your browser, with no apps to download, making it accessible across all of your devices.
Our Work Is Sound

As a company of seasoned music & audio professionals, we know exactly how powerful sound can be on the mind & body. In our initial research trial, we measured the impact ""Prelude"" has on psychological & physiological wellbeing. Here's what we found:
Prelude"" significantly reduces stress in less than 5 minutes!
Decreases negative mood states & increases positive mood states
Particularly effective for people with depression
Recommended for everyday life, as well as medical, mental health, & education settings
Featured in:
THE TEAM
Founder

Jeff McSpadden is Composure's Founder & CEO. Jeff has spent decades as a professional composer & multi-instrumentalist honing the skills to create emotionally evocative music & sound for film, television, advertising & new media. His work can be heard on NBC, CBS, PBS, HBO, AMC, A&E, FX, Nat Geo, History & others. Additionally, Jeff's compositions have been included in campaigns for Mercedes-Benz, Verizon, Toshiba, L.L. Bean, Ford, Progressive, & Nabisco, as well as a variety of independent films, digital media & album projects.

As Founder of Composure, Jeff was recently invited to be a member of the 2018 Transformative Tech Academy which brings together Global Leaders, Innovators, & Entrepreneurs who are leveraging tech for mental health, wellbeing, & human thriving. Jeff has also been a panel moderator at NYVR Expo 2018 & a guest lecturer at The New School & NYU in New York City.
Lead Developer

Ian Petrarca is a New York City based developer & sound engineer working on audio-driven interactive experiences. He has created software & hardware solutions for clients looking to include audio in their products, physical spaces & websites. Ian is currently focusing on projects that include spatial audio.
Ian has worked with companies like Composure, Man Made Music, Equal Entry, Betaworks Studios & Dots.
Advisors & Mentors
Back us today & share this campaign with those you care about.
Simply use the Indiegogo share tools to connect us with your community.
Thank you.",15.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","New York City, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/composure-get-calm-give-calm/pica

For generations, India has been associated with spirituality and yoga gurus. Jeevah’s mission is to bring this wealth of knowledge to everyone through cutting-edge technology and foster a world without disease.

 

 

 

Built from cutting-edge artificial intelligence technology, the Jeevah yoga assistant customizes workouts based on age, weight, and medical history. Each yoga routine is outcome-oriented and research-backed—part of a library of proven yoga programs and 100+ wellness videos.

 

Using a proprietary machine learning algorithm, real-time stress notifications alert you to signs of stress and remind you to breathe deeply.

 

State-of-the-art, trans-reflective LCD screen creates a sharp, easy-to-read display, whether you take your yoga journey indoors or into direct sunlight..

 

Life is noisy and distracting. Your smartwatch shouldn’t be. The sleek and simple design allows easy use of buttons to navigate. Access is required for your personal security.

 

IP67 water-resistant smartwatch with a battery life of more than 5 days for a full charge.

 

More features :
• Notification Center
• Call Notification (iPhone and Android compatibility)
• Watch Faces
• Calendar and Weather
• Phone Location Service
• Step Counter
• Heart Rate Monitor
• Music Control
• Interchangeable Watch Strap
• Available in two colors: Black/White

Unlike other smartwatches, we don’t provide trackers for every sport. We specialize in yoga to ensure our approach complements your goal of a healthy lifestyle.

Life’s greatest joys are the simple ones. So we focus only on the features you need, without the extra applications and endless notifications. Our minimalist design reduces the clutter and clears your path to a healthier tomorrow.

With the aid of trusted research partners, we have rooted each Jeevah yoga module in extensive data in order to combat specific health issues.

 

Yoga isn’t just another sport. This isn’t just another smartwatch. Jeevah provides a stress management tool with real-time notification when you experience stress.

We built an ecosystem for a complete 360-degree yoga solution. The plan includes a wearable smartwatch, free Jeevah mobile App (iOS/Android), and SaaS platform for live trainings, workshops, and consultations from seasoned yoga gurus

 

 

 

 

Jeevah connects by Bluetooth to your iPhone or Android device. Setting up Jeevah is as easy as downloading the Jeevah app onto your phone. All software updates are wirelessly transmitted to your Jeevah.

    What do you get?
• Jeevah Watch – watch + cable + manual
• Free App Download – with 100+ HD yoga videos
• MyJeevah : Webapp subscription based SaaS platform, for live streaming workshops and in-person consultation
Compatibility
• iPhone 6, 6S+ running iOS 8+.
• Android devices running OS 2.3 and up. Works great with Android 4.0
• Jeevah is not compatible with Blackberry, Windows Phone 7, or Palm phones currently

We’ve been developing smartwatches for more than two years. The Jeevah watch seen in the above video is a working prototype. 

Together, we can bring Jeevah to wrists worldwide. While our team is close to entering production, your contribution will help fund:

- Production tooling 
- Complete App/SaaS development.
- Large component order
- Certifications

We hope to complete the development of the mobile and webapp soon. Each of our backers will receive early access as beta users of the product!

Founded in 2015, Jeevah aspires to define the next generation of human-machine interaction. We are on a mission to bring balance to the lives of technology lovers by seamlessly integrating innovation and well-being.

We have a large, diverse team from the United States, Australia, UK, and India
column2:
70% of our team are world-class engineers, with AI researchers, software developers, hardware engineers, and product-to-market practitioners. Together, we are building your dream smartwatch.

Though varied in backgrounds, our team is unified in vision: to deliver knowledge of yogic practices and Ayurveda to all people through our technology, and to create a disease-free world.

 

 

Design Partners:

  • Product Feasibility &
column3:
Hardware consultant: Predictable-designs by John Teel

Research Partners:

• Yogic Research - Patanjali, India

Marketing Partners :-

  • Matix Labs

column2:
High Resolution Pictures 

 

 

We are currently working hard at our software iterations, consolidating production plans, and coordinating third-party vendors. However, we still would like to inform you certain risks and challenges. 

We understand the risks of development and production better than most. Bringing a product from an idea to reality requires hard work, perseverance, and a dedicated team.

There will be challenges and unexpected hurdles along the way. There always are. We’ve built in plenty of time to test everything at every step of the way. We’ve learned the hard way that there is no such thing as too much testing, and we will make sure to deliver a quality product to our backers at the end of the line.

In the unlikely event that we encounter an obstacle that delays the shipping timeline, we promise to communicate with you every step of the way.

International Logistics Risk 
Our watches include lithium batteries, which makes them more difficult to ship. The speed and price of the shipping may vary with the number of units we deliver to each country.

Supply Chain Risk 
We’ve spent the past few years building an efficient and capable supply chain team. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. In such cases, we will keep you informed and do our best to quickly solve every situation to your satisfaction. Disclaimer: We are launching our campaign on behalf of Oakwish Ecommerce LLP, IN.

Our Projects

By joining forces with Floating Doctors, we will be screening patients throughout the islands of Bocas del Toro, Panama. Not only will we be able to screen for a variety of conditions using Ultrasound, but we will also be educating local health care workers so they can continue to improve access to medical care in this remote location. Our projects include...
  • Prenatal screening: using the ROUTE screening guidelines, we can identify high-risk pregnancies and get information regarding fetal age and size, placenta location, amniotic fluid levels, fetal position, etc.

• Prenatal education: we will be working with local parteras (community midwives) to improve awareness in the topics of nutrition, sanitation, use of prenatal vitamins, family planning strategies and more.
  • Screening for cardiac abnormalities can identify congenital heart defects that put patients at risk for sudden death. We will also be characterizing the prevalence of such defects in this population.
  • Screening for gallstones: we will be using Ultrasound to identify gallstones, which, if left untreated, can cause serious complications. We will be educating health care workers in identification of gallstones with Ultrasound technology and identifying the prevalence of gallstones in this population.

Why Should I Donate?

  • It's hard to imagine living in a place where you don't have access to medical care if you need it. It's even harder to imagine never having seen a doctor. Yet this is the reality for many of the patients we will be serving. Supporting Floating Doctors allows underserved communities to access necessary health care and avoid preventable disease and death!
  • This Panama mission has been a success for the past several years - each year the partnership with Floating Doctors has grown stronger and the range of our projects has expanded. 
  • Bringing Ultrasound to rural, underserved communities really stretches your dollars! It is the most cost-effective, safe and efficient way of bringing medical care (literally on board) and serving as many patients as possible.

<b>A
Brief Introduction
Hey
there! We are Reckon Point. Nice to see you took the time to read
this.
We
are a new, innovating company that is designing an app, just for you,
that will help you locate exactly what you need
theater, to the can of tomatoes your mother just has to have. This
app will get you where you need to be, when you need to be
there-plus, it will advertise any sales going on in shops you enter.
Perfect for when you want those pair of shoes!
Using
advanced technology developed by the team, this app will be using a
Geo-location  navigation system that can be accessed though a cloud,
where thousands upon thousands of stores and items will reside. Cool,
huh? Reckon Point will tell you where to find these items, and how to
get to them. All it takes is some calibration!
<b>What
We Need, &amp
So,
you're wondering-why such a large amount of donations? In fact, what
do we need? While we can't tell you exactly what we need (top
secret!), we can guarantee that this money will be used to help make
this technology even better than it already is. Parts are expensive,
and we need anything we can possibly get.  Even if you can't donate,
we also need people to spread the word as much as possible. How else
will people know about this? By doing that, you would really be doing
us a favor. Plus, it would make you look wicked cool.
What
you'll get in return is listed in the perks. You have the chance of
being an amazing donor, plus you'll get some pretty awesome gifts too,
besides the app that is being made.
<b>The
Impact
This
solution is what the world has been waiting for: sub-meter indoor
positioning! But first, we need to do the behind the scenes work.
Currently, we are developing a prototype collection system that can
gather the data. Creating an app is useless until you have data
to work with. Since each location is unique, a system is needed that can
quickly and easily maneuver indoors to collect these types of
signals. Cool, right?
Reckon
Point wants this technology to become the standard indoor positioning
solution providing sub-meter accuracy for everyone to use and for
other companies to build upon.
Can
you imagine never being lost again, feeling fear of losing your kids
or being scared in emergency situations?
Especially
if you're under a lot of pressure-say, you're looking for a specific
room that you're meeting is in. You don't know if they could have
changed the room, so that's one tick-Reckon Point will tell you if
you're meeting has been moved or canceled. Then, trying to locate the
room. Reading signs can get confusing, and you may not always
remember what floor number it could be on. With Reckon Point, there's
absolutely no worry. All you have to do is find your meeting, and
check the stats. Perfectly handy for when you've had a rough morning
(and, hopefully, some coffee.)
Reckon
Point’s technology can also be used to help the seeing impaired navigate around
complex buildings such as hospitals.  There are people who have a hard
time reading distant signs and small wall maps.  With turn by turn indoor
navigation, people can regain their independence and feel comfortable
navigating in complex indoor environments.
Another
benefit of this technology is the ability to track inventory in a large
building.  Imagine being able to know where high value assets are at a
moment’s notice saving time and money.  Many companies spend a significant
amount of time tracking down inventory. Our technology allows for real time
inventory location on a map.  A system based on our indoor location
technology could be developed to click on an item in an inventory list and a
map would show where the item is in the building
The
Competition of a Company
While
other companies presently provide indoor location solutions, none of
them have yet been able to reliably provide consistent sub-meter
accuracy. Our 30 years combined DOD experience in signal intelligence
and geo-location systems will provide the edge needed to solve this
problem.
Preliminary
results show consistent 1 meter accuracy with sparse data. Now,
imagine what we can do with high resolution data!
<b>What
Other Ways Can You Help?
You
can help us by liking our Facebook page and sending it around to
people who may be interested.  We also have a Twitter, if you want to
check that out. By spreading the word through social media, you'll
help boost what's coming your way.
Tell
your friends! Tell you family! Heck, tell your boss about this! Tell
anyone you possibly can. Make it a competition, and see how many
people you can tell!
If
you are willing to donate, anything helps! Ten dollars, twenty, one
hundred...perhaps even a penny. Anything to reach our goal. Every
dollar donated helps!
Follow

Brief Introduction
Hey
there! We are Reckon Point. Nice to see you took the time to read
this.
We
are a new, innovating company that is designing an app, just for you,
that will help you locate exactly what you need
theater, to the can of tomatoes your mother just has to have. This
app will get you where you need to be, when you need to be
there-plus, it will advertise any sales going on in shops you enter.
Perfect for when you want those pair of shoes!
Using
advanced technology developed by the team, this app will be using a
Geo-location  navigation system that can be accessed though a cloud,
where thousands upon thousands of stores and items will reside. Cool,
huh? Reckon Point will tell you where to find these items, and how to
get to them. All it takes is some calibration!
What
We Need, & What You Get
So,
you're wondering-why such a large amount of donations? In fact, what
do we need? While we can't tell you exactly what we need (top
secret!), we can guarantee that this money will be used to help make
this technology even better than it already is. Parts are expensive,
and we need anything we can possibly get.  Even if you can't donate,
we also need people to spread the word as much as possible. How else
will people know about this? By doing that, you would really be doing
us a favor. Plus, it would make you look wicked cool.
What
you'll get in return is listed in the perks. You have the chance of
being an amazing donor, plus you'll get some pretty awesome gifts too,
besides the app that is being made.
The
Impact
This
solution is what the world has been waiting for: sub-meter indoor
positioning! But first, we need to do the behind the scenes work.
Currently, we are developing a prototype collection system that can
gather the data. Creating an app is useless until you have data
to work with. Since each location is unique, a system is needed that can
quickly and easily maneuver indoors to collect these types of
signals. Cool, right?
Reckon
Point wants this technology to become the standard indoor positioning
solution providing sub-meter accuracy for everyone to use and for
other companies to build upon.
Can
you imagine never being lost again, feeling fear of losing your kids
or being scared in emergency situations?
Especially
if you're under a lot of pressure-say, you're looking for a specific
room that you're meeting is in. You don't know if they could have
changed the room, so that's one tick-Reckon Point will tell you if
you're meeting has been moved or canceled. Then, trying to locate the
room. Reading signs can get confusing, and you may not always
remember what floor number it could be on. With Reckon Point, there's
absolutely no worry. All you have to do is find your meeting, and
check the stats. Perfectly handy for when you've had a rough morning
(and, hopefully, some coffee.)
Reckon
Point’s technology can also be used to help the seeing impaired navigate around
complex buildings such as hospitals.  There are people who have a hard
time reading distant signs and small wall maps.  With turn by turn indoor
navigation, people can regain their independence and feel comfortable
navigating in complex indoor environments.
Another
benefit of this technology is the ability to track inventory in a large
building.  Imagine being able to know where high value assets are at a
moment’s notice saving time and money.  Many companies spend a significant
amount of time tracking down inventory. Our technology allows for real time
inventory location on a map.  A system based on our indoor location
technology could be developed to click on an item in an inventory list and a
map would show where the item is in the building
The
Competition of a Company
While
other companies presently provide indoor location solutions, none of
them have yet been able to reliably provide consistent sub-meter
accuracy. Our 30 years combined DOD experience in signal intelligence
and geo-location systems will provide the edge needed to solve this
problem.
Preliminary
results show consistent 1 meter accuracy with sparse data. Now,
imagine what we can do with high resolution data!
What
Other Ways Can You Help?
You
can help us by liking our Facebook page and sending it around to
people who may be interested.  We also have a Twitter, if you want to
check that out. By spreading the word through social media, you'll
help boost what's coming your way.
Tell
your friends! Tell you family! Heck, tell your boss about this! Tell
anyone you possibly can. Make it a competition, and see how many
people you can tell!
If
you are willing to donate, anything helps! Ten dollars, twenty, one
hundred...perhaps even a penny. Anything to reach our goal. Every
dollar donated helps!

column1: <div style=""text-align: center
WE GIVE BACK

For me, there was no other option but to give back. I am a single mother and I care about the future for my child and for all children. I have been in the hair care industry for over 30 years and I wanted to help those who helped me.

I knew what kind of quality product I was looking for. I have been a salon owner, platform artist, and worked with trade magazines.  I chose to give to the Human Rights Campaign which is America's largest civil rights organization working to achieve lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender equality. The LGBTQIA+ community has been very close to me throughout my career.
WHERE WE STAND NOW

We've spent the last year carefully designing and developing our formulations and our mission and now we need your help and backing to reach all our goals and to help get us up and running. The money we raise will go to getting the product manufactured as well as all promotional endeavors to spread the word. We think everyone deserves beautiful hair and we created an outstanding product for the world to experience. If we reach our goal, we'll be able to achieve what has always been in our hearts and will give back while it brings out the beauty of hair.
Thank you.
Brutus &

[1] Use of Funds:
There are several models in use that are

producing astonishing results. Over many years with these models, our team has gained unparalleled experience and expertise. Research has uncovered phenomenal benefits to overall human performance and the role of the neuromuscular system in effective movements. By uniquely responding to every user, our technology provides optimal training conditions for maximal neuromuscular function. Therapeutic applications include optimal improvement in the control of the body's movements, joint stabilization, balance, and dynamic movements. These areas of improvement are vital for those who have become physically disabled.
We are looking to raise $75,000 in order to accomplish several objectives...

• Responds to each user's unique patterns with fully programmable resistance to meet each individual's capabilities and needs.
• Provides all modes of exercise - isotonic, isometric, isokinetic, isoacceleration, and more.
• Applies no external load to the user, minimizing muscle soreness and promoting recovery.
• Enables real-time visual feedback, which has been clearly shown to be a source of motivation as progress becomes more tangible.
• Gives the clinician, the coach, and the user objective feedback necessary to evaluate effort, progress, and training effectiveness.
In addition, the RK-7 will include these capabilities:
<div>
<ul>
• Automated training programs can be designed and created, allowing individuals and groups of users to run programs with a click of a button.
• Programmed diagnostics allow programs to automatically evolve with each user to optimize conditions and reach goals faster.
• Collects and calculates over 50 performance variables and proprietary metrics, any of which can be instantaneously displayed. Our ""competition window"" provides motivation for groups and users.
• Can display continuously-updated visual reports (graphs, charts, tables) making it easy to track and evaluate progress at all times.
• Allows real-time movement analysis, which can be displayed and bio-mechanically analyzed.
• Provides full data management, analysis, and reporting capabilities that can be customized.
• Software platform allows for wireless connection of peripheral devices.
• Smartphone applications will allow users to initiate training programs and download results.

As a company, RKS is committed to providing research-quality information to the global community about the exciting possibilities that multi-joint, responsive resistance can provide. We are committed to becoming a leader in the field of applied, multi-joint, neuromuscular performance and training, and to help understand how this training can improve the lives of our community.

[4] Glossary of Terms:
Forms of Exercise:
<div><ul>
<li>
Isotonic -- A contraction where the muscle changes length when moving against a constant load. (Example: dumbbell curl)
<li>
Isometric -- A contraction when joint angle and muscle length do not change. (Example: pushing against a wall)
<li>
Isokinetic -- A contraction when the muscle contracts maximally and speed of movement does not change.
<div>
The Importance of Isokinetics:

Findings demonstrate that isokinetic training at both low and high speeds can be superior to traditional isotonic methods of training. And the use of isokinetics on injured joints for evaluation and rehabilitation commonplace.

Isokinetic exercise provides variable resistance to a movement so that no matter how much effort is exerted, the movement takes place at a constant speed.  Isokinetic exercise allows for the highest degree of muscle contraction while also promoting a free range of movement of the limbs.
In isokinetic training, the resistance is controlled by the equipment    -  so there is no external loading. This form of resistance prevents muscle damage, which prevents soreness and overtraining.

Isokinetic exercise is primarily used on isolated joint movements. In rehabilitation and sport, they are used to obtain objective recordings of muscular function. Results are used in performer screening and testing, thereby, establishing both a performance baseline and a database for periodic assessment. However, every study reporting superior results may or may not translate into real-world, multi-joint, closed-chin movement goals.
The Kinetic Chain:

The term ""kinetic chain"" is used to describe how you are moving the parts of your body. If the moving parts are allowed to move freely in space, it is known as an Open Kinetic Chain (OKC) movement. On the other hand, if the moving parts are pressing against an unrelenting surface, it is known as a Closed Kinetic Chain (CKC) movement.

In OKC exercises the force applied by the body is great enough to overcome the resistance. An example would be a bench press or leg press, where applied muscle force moves the load away from the body. CKC exercises are characterized by muscle force that is not great enough to overcome the resistance. An example would be the squat exercise, where the force generated is applied to the ground, not the bar. The body parts that the resistance moves through make up the components of the chain.

Open Kinetic Chain exercises are movements where the force applied by the body is great enough to overcome the resistance. An example of an open chain exercise would be a bench press, or any leg press which allows the force applied to move the load away from the body.
The kinetic chain is only as strong as the weakest link. Therefore, applications of isokinetic exercise and isolated joint testing along the kinetic chain is important.
If the clinician were to never measure the strength of the joints along the kinetic chain, then the weak link can never be identified for rehabilitation.
Open Kinetic Chain Exercises vs Closed Kinetic Chain Exercises:

The upper extremity functions almost exclusively in an OKC pattern. The throwing motion, volleyball spike, tennis serve, and golf stroke are all examples of OKC activities. On the other hand, most functional movements of the lower extremity occur in a CKC environment. Lower extremity CKC movements include all forms of upright human locomotion.

CKC exercise is more functional because it closely simulates the actual movement patterns encountered in both sport and daily activities. For example, when pushing off of the ground, the hip, knee, and ankle move together in a CKC movement. With athletes, CKC exercise has been shown to greatly improve functional strength and jumping ability.
Isolated vs Multi-joint Movement:

Isolated muscle action at a singel joint can identify the weak link. However, all joints in a kinetic chain must work together for optimal function. If a muscle cannot function normally within either an OKC or CKC pattern, then the functional movement will suffer, and risk of injury (or re-injury) will be higher.

Therefore, during training and rehabilitation, it is critical that the body learns (or re-learns) how the parts must work together along the kinetic chain for optimal performance and minimal risk of injury. This involves the entire neuromuscular system, and can only be accomplished with multi-joint exercise.
Advantages of Multi-joint, Closed Kinetic Chain Exercise:
Isolated, single-joint exercises can evaluate and train isolated muscles along the kinetic chain. However, movements in sport and activity always involve multi-joint patterns.

In rehabilitation, single-joint exercises at controlled isokinetic speeds are used to restore muscle strength. However, when training for functional movements, multi-joint, CKC exercises are preferred.

CKC exercises are safer - particularly with regard to healing knee and shoulder injuries, because they create less shear stress across injured or healing joints. Furthermore, multi-joint CKC exercise will improve proprioception and reflex stabilization, thus reducing pain and promoting a FASTER and MORE COMPLETE RETURN to DAILY ACTIVITIES and SPORTS.
The RK-7 technology is the only type of system that provides all of these conditions: multi-joint, open and/or closed kinetic chain exercise under conditions of controlled speed.

The RK-7 is not limited to simple isokinetics - that is only one of many functions. With our responsive resistance, any pattern of speed can be programmed to meet user-specific capabilities and needs. in addition, isotonic and/or isometric conditions can be added.
With the RK-7, we take rehabilitation and performance training to the next level.

[6] Our Team:
Terence Herzog - Chief Executive Officer

Mr. Herzog, a veteran of the US Navy, has over 50 years of experience in business, focusing predominantly on the financial and investment banking industry. Over the years, Mr. Herzog has served as an Officer and Director of many companies and has been the CEO of various companies across a wide range of industries including electrical contracting, corporate sponsorship &
column2: entertainment, motion picture production and casting, bio-tech, telecommunications, and corporate &amp

column1: Arthur Tullman - President

Mr. Tullman assembled the management team and advisory board. He is a specialist in health club development, business management, and celebrity and product marketing. Mr. Tullman began his career in the health &
column2: fitness industry as a General Manager at one of New York’s most successful health corporations, The New York Health and Racquet Club. Mr. Tullman created, ""Total Sports Management"", which designed, developed, and managed fitness facilities for major New York-based real estate developers. His team of over 100 employees managed over 15 locations throughout Manhattan.

column1: Mr. Tullman is a graduate of The College at Brockport State University.
Christopher Williams, PhD., CSCS - Chief Science Officer

Dr. Williams is an Associate Professor in the Department of Kinesiology, Sport Studies and Physical Education (KSSPE) at The Collage at Brockport, State University of New York. His specialty is in biomechanics, kinesiology, exercise science, and strength and conditioning. Dr. Williams has investigated areas such as the electromechanical delay, neuromechanics, neuromuscular motor drive, bilateral deficit, balance, and special populations. Dr. Williams has published several times on these topics, including the authorship of two textbooks. Dr. Williams received his BS and MS from the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, and he earned his PhD from Auburn University.

In 2011, Dr. Williams launched the Power Training Program - a collaboration between the Biomechanics Lab and Athletics Department to develop explosive power in athletes. Over 500 student-athletes in over 20 sports and activities have trained for sport-specific power and rehabilitation using Dr. Williams’ strategies and techniques. In addition, over 100 undergraduate exercise science students have worked in the lab as a research team to administer the program.

The Power Training Program is unique in the world, using principles and tools in biomechanics, strength and conditioning, and rehabilitation to develop exercise, sequencing, and periodization protocols. What makes it stand apart is the use of responsive kinetic technology. Dr. Williams’ Power Training Program is the only research-quality athlete training program utilizing all of these capabilities for sport-specific power and performance. Research in the Biomechanics Lab has and continues to investigate the effect of responsive kinetics on explosive power, rate of force development, joint stability, balance, and neuromuscular performance.

As a result of the success of the Power Training Program, Dr. Williams has consulted with many teams and institutions - including high profile organizations such as the US Olympic Track and Field team, Russian Ministry of Sport, NY Knicks, Sacramento Kings, and Philadelphia Flyers. Each of these organizations use strategies and protocols developed by Dr. Williams in his Power Training Program to meet their individual needs in athlete training, maintenance, and rehabilitation.
Frank Julian - Director of Manufacturing

Mr. Julian, a veteran of the US Army, is also a supply chain management expert. His work history includes hundreds of companies over a diverse range of industries encompassing well-established entities to startups. He founded SBM Inc. in 1993 to help these companies overcome hurdles as they move to the next level by creating efficiency via improving operations, lowering overhead, and developing strategic alliances to expand manufacturing and supply capabilities on a global scale. Mr. Julian is an advocate of virtual outsourcing, which takes advantage of existing manufacturing and fulfillment resources that are more cost effective.

Mr. Julian earned a Bachelor of Science degree with a minor in Business Administration from the University of Massachusetts. He also served in the National Guard based in Worcester, MA, from 1969 to 1971 and the United States Army from 1971 to 1973. He participated in an exchange program with the West German Army, and was honorably discharged E-4.
Al Joyner
<blockquote>""The RKS technology is a <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

Al Joyner went to Arkansas State University. He competed with their track and field team throughout his college career. By the time he graduated, Al was a three-time NCAA All-American indoor champion, a three-time NCAA All-American outdoor champion, and a four-time Southland Conference Champ.

In 1984, Al traveled to Los Angeles for the Summer Games to compete with the U.S. Olympic track and field team. With a leap of 56'-7.5"", he became the first African American in 80 years to win a gold medal in the triple jump. Al was also honored with the Jim Thorpe Award, which is given every four years to the best American competitor in an Olympic Field Event.
Al coached Florence Griffith (Flo Jo) to 3 gold medals &
column2: 1 silver in the 100, 200,4x 100m relay and 4x400m relay. Al’s sister Jackie Joyner Kersee competed in the heptathlon. When she captured silver in the event, they became the first sibling teammates in U.S. history to medal during the same Olympics.

column1: As the Jump Coach at UCLA, Al won the NCAA 2002 Indoors Track &

column3: Coach of the Fastest Woman Sprinter in the History of Track &amp
column4: Field, the late Florence Griffith Joyner (Flo-Jo), to 2 world and Olympic records, which stills stands today. [9] How You Can Help:
Every contribution helps RK-7 achieve it's goal of helping veterans. All donations mean a lot, regardless of size.
We appreciate your attention. We salute you, and we appreciate your help in advance.
Please SHARE this with all of your social media contacts. Together, we can make our equipment attainable to rehabbing veterans.
","The RK-7 responds to suit the user's specific needs -- something that can't be accomplished as accurately and efficiently in the weight room or physical therapy facility.

Our technology responds uniquely to each user to meet individual goals, and can track the user's progress and evolve. Users move in complete safety, with no external loads and minimal muscle damage. As users move through full ranges of motion, muscles are never overstressed, leading to quicker recovery times. The RK7 provides the optimal conditions for neuromuscular performance and development.

There are nearly 23 million veterans in the United States and many of them have sustained both mental and/or physical injuries during their service. It is our sincere hope to help meet the unique rehabilitative needs of our disabled veterans, particularly those who suffer from neuromuscular and physical disability. Our team believes disabled veterans deserve the best care possible, and that the RK7 is the most effective, safest, and efficient way to restore optimal function of the human performer. By doing everything possible to rehabilitate our veterans, we ensure to promote greater movement potential and quality of life.

It is our goal as a company to facilitate the rehabilitation of disabled veterans.   We will revolutionize the arena of human performance with the RK-7 in areas of  rehabilitation, performance and evaluation. Unique applications are available to every demographic. And we intend to demonstrate the benefits of our RK7 technology for each.
Our corporate identity will set the tone for future corporations to come. A corporation with a social awareness of the individual need's of the community that surrounds us.

[1] Use of Funds:
There are several models in use that are

producing astonishing results. Over many years with these models, our team has gained unparalleled experience and expertise. Research has uncovered phenomenal benefits to overall human performance and the role of the neuromuscular system in effective movements. By uniquely responding to every user, our technology provides optimal training conditions for maximal neuromuscular function. Therapeutic applications include optimal improvement in the control of the body's movements, joint stabilization, balance, and dynamic movements. These areas of improvement are vital for those who have become physically disabled.
We are looking to raise $75,000 in order to accomplish several objectives...
Produce the RK7 - our next-generation system with state-of-the-art components.
Update the software platform to improve function and user-friendliness.
Donate RK-7's and our support and expertise to veteran rehabilitation facilities.
Establish training protocols and functionality to address unique rehabilitation goals for disabled veterans.
[2] The RK-7:
Ideal for full restoration & development of  functionality, power, strength, and speed.
Responds to each user's unique patterns with fully programmable resistance to meet each individual's capabilities and needs.
Provides all modes of exercise - isotonic, isometric, isokinetic, isoacceleration, and more.
Applies no external load to the user, minimizing muscle soreness and promoting recovery.
Enables real-time visual feedback, which has been clearly shown to be a source of motivation as progress becomes more tangible.
Gives the clinician, the coach, and the user objective feedback necessary to evaluate effort, progress, and training effectiveness.
In addition, the RK-7 will include these capabilities:
Automated training programs can be designed and created, allowing individuals and groups of users to run programs with a click of a button.
Programmed diagnostics allow programs to automatically evolve with each user to optimize conditions and reach goals faster.
Collects and calculates over 50 performance variables and proprietary metrics, any of which can be instantaneously displayed. Our ""competition window"" provides motivation for groups and users.
Can display continuously-updated visual reports (graphs, charts, tables) making it easy to track and evaluate progress at all times.
Allows real-time movement analysis, which can be displayed and bio-mechanically analyzed.
Provides full data management, analysis, and reporting capabilities that can be customized.
Software platform allows for wireless connection of peripheral devices.
Smartphone applications will allow users to initiate training programs and download results.

As a company, RKS is committed to providing research-quality information to the global community about the exciting possibilities that multi-joint, responsive resistance can provide. We are committed to becoming a leader in the field of applied, multi-joint, neuromuscular performance and training, and to help understand how this training can improve the lives of our community.

[4] Glossary of Terms:
Forms of Exercise:
Isotonic -- A contraction where the muscle changes length when moving against a constant load. (Example: dumbbell curl)
Isometric -- A contraction when joint angle and muscle length do not change. (Example: pushing against a wall)
Isokinetic -- A contraction when the muscle contracts maximally and speed of movement does not change.
The Importance of Isokinetics:

Findings demonstrate that isokinetic training at both low and high speeds can be superior to traditional isotonic methods of training. And the use of isokinetics on injured joints for evaluation and rehabilitation commonplace.

Isokinetic exercise provides variable resistance to a movement so that no matter how much effort is exerted, the movement takes place at a constant speed.  Isokinetic exercise allows for the highest degree of muscle contraction while also promoting a free range of movement of the limbs.
In isokinetic training, the resistance is controlled by the equipment    -  so there is no external loading. This form of resistance prevents muscle damage, which prevents soreness and overtraining.

Isokinetic exercise is primarily used on isolated joint movements. In rehabilitation and sport, they are used to obtain objective recordings of muscular function. Results are used in performer screening and testing, thereby, establishing both a performance baseline and a database for periodic assessment. However, every study reporting superior results may or may not translate into real-world, multi-joint, closed-chin movement goals.
The Kinetic Chain:

The term ""kinetic chain"" is used to describe how you are moving the parts of your body. If the moving parts are allowed to move freely in space, it is known as an Open Kinetic Chain (OKC) movement. On the other hand, if the moving parts are pressing against an unrelenting surface, it is known as a Closed Kinetic Chain (CKC) movement.

In OKC exercises the force applied by the body is great enough to overcome the resistance. An example would be a bench press or leg press, where applied muscle force moves the load away from the body. CKC exercises are characterized by muscle force that is not great enough to overcome the resistance. An example would be the squat exercise, where the force generated is applied to the ground, not the bar. The body parts that the resistance moves through make up the components of the chain.

Open Kinetic Chain exercises are movements where the force applied by the body is great enough to overcome the resistance. An example of an open chain exercise would be a bench press, or any leg press which allows the force applied to move the load away from the body.
The kinetic chain is only as strong as the weakest link. Therefore, applications of isokinetic exercise and isolated joint testing along the kinetic chain is important.
If the clinician were to never measure the strength of the joints along the kinetic chain, then the weak link can never be identified for rehabilitation.
Open Kinetic Chain Exercises vs Closed Kinetic Chain Exercises:

The upper extremity functions almost exclusively in an OKC pattern. The throwing motion, volleyball spike, tennis serve, and golf stroke are all examples of OKC activities. On the other hand, most functional movements of the lower extremity occur in a CKC environment. Lower extremity CKC movements include all forms of upright human locomotion.

CKC exercise is more functional because it closely simulates the actual movement patterns encountered in both sport and daily activities. For example, when pushing off of the ground, the hip, knee, and ankle move together in a CKC movement. With athletes, CKC exercise has been shown to greatly improve functional strength and jumping ability.
Isolated vs Multi-joint Movement:

Isolated muscle action at a singel joint can identify the weak link. However, all joints in a kinetic chain must work together for optimal function. If a muscle cannot function normally within either an OKC or CKC pattern, then the functional movement will suffer, and risk of injury (or re-injury) will be higher.

Therefore, during training and rehabilitation, it is critical that the body learns (or re-learns) how the parts must work together along the kinetic chain for optimal performance and minimal risk of injury. This involves the entire neuromuscular system, and can only be accomplished with multi-joint exercise.
Advantages of Multi-joint, Closed Kinetic Chain Exercise:
Isolated, single-joint exercises can evaluate and train isolated muscles along the kinetic chain. However, movements in sport and activity always involve multi-joint patterns.

In rehabilitation, single-joint exercises at controlled isokinetic speeds are used to restore muscle strength. However, when training for functional movements, multi-joint, CKC exercises are preferred.

CKC exercises are safer - particularly with regard to healing knee and shoulder injuries, because they create less shear stress across injured or healing joints. Furthermore, multi-joint CKC exercise will improve proprioception and reflex stabilization, thus reducing pain and promoting a FASTER and MORE COMPLETE RETURN to DAILY ACTIVITIES and SPORTS.
The RK-7 technology is the only type of system that provides all of these conditions: multi-joint, open and/or closed kinetic chain exercise under conditions of controlled speed.

The RK-7 is not limited to simple isokinetics - that is only one of many functions. With our responsive resistance, any pattern of speed can be programmed to meet user-specific capabilities and needs. in addition, isotonic and/or isometric conditions can be added.
With the RK-7, we take rehabilitation and performance training to the next level.
[5] RK-7 Rehabilitation Process:
Early Stages - Post-Injury / Surgery

The RK-7's Isokinetic, or Variable Velocity Mode, allows for early stage rehabilitation with minimal risk of re-injury. The user can use maximum effort while avoiding unnecessary pain and muscle fatigue, which helps to safely restore normal range of motion.

In this passive mode, the RK-7 offers accommodating resistance to the forces exerted by the user during acceleration and deceleration throughout a range of motion and during isometric holds. At the same time, speed and velocity patterns of user movement can be set by the clinician to more realistically simulate dynamics of real motion

The RK-7 Isometric Mode helps to identify and test specific joints and muscles, which enables clinicians to pinpoint areas of weakness and equips them with the ability to strengthen these areas safely and comfortably.
Middle Stages – Restore Strength & Return to Function

The RK-7 Isotonic, or Variable Resistance Mode, allows for varying resistance within and at any point during a particular range of motion to accommodate for injuries and natural mechanical inefficiencies.

The mechanical advantage of most muscles changes as the associated joint is flexed or extended. The variable resistance feature compensates for this change by becoming progressively easier or more difficult, thereby maintaining  constant muscular exertion throughout the entire range of movement.

The RK-7's unique ability to create isometric “sticking” points at any one specific point, or at multiple points along the range of motion, allows clinicians to target contractions at different problem points through the range of motion.
Final Stages – Building Power, Strength, & Speed

Most functional, task, and sport-specific movements occur in a Closed Kinetic Chain environment. Therefore, you need a machine that can train in the same way. With the RK-7,users can train just as they would perform in everyday life or even on the field of play.

Closed Kinetic Chain exercise protocols are used extensively in the rehabilitation of many injuries from the ankle, to the knee, to the shoulder. They are preferable to other exercise protocols in that Closed Kinetic Chan simulates normal physiology and encourages natural biomechanics. This creates minimal shear stress across injured or healing joints, reproduces proprioceptive stimuli, and allows for use in early rehabilitation
column2: integral aspects of any “accelerated"" rehabilitation program.

column1: Only the RK-7 controls velocity and force and provides bi-directional, isokinetic features to mimic real-life movements associated with normal and even extraordinary (high adrenaline or athletic) performance. The RK-7 easily adapts to each individual user, simulating natural movement patterns previously unattainable with other systems. The value of an exercise therapy prescription and the validity of performance data no longer need to be compromised by lack of movement specificity.
[6] Our Team:
Terence Herzog - Chief Executive Officer

Mr. Herzog, a veteran of the US Navy, has over 50 years of experience in business, focusing predominantly on the financial and investment banking industry. Over the years, Mr. Herzog has served as an Officer and Director of many companies and has been the CEO of various companies across a wide range of industries including electrical contracting, corporate sponsorship & entertainment, motion picture production and casting, bio-tech, telecommunications, and corporate & investment banking consulting businesses.
Arthur Tullman - President

Mr. Tullman assembled the management team and advisory board. He is a specialist in health club development, business management, and celebrity and product marketing. Mr. Tullman began his career in the health & fitness industry as a General Manager at one of New York’s most successful health corporations, The New York Health and Racquet Club. Mr. Tullman created, ""Total Sports Management"", which designed, developed, and managed fitness facilities for major New York-based real estate developers. His team of over 100 employees managed over 15 locations throughout Manhattan.
Mr. Tullman is a graduate of The College at Brockport State University.
Christopher Williams, PhD., CSCS - Chief Science Officer

Dr. Williams is an Associate Professor in the Department of Kinesiology, Sport Studies and Physical Education (KSSPE) at The Collage at Brockport, State University of New York. His specialty is in biomechanics, kinesiology, exercise science, and strength and conditioning. Dr. Williams has investigated areas such as the electromechanical delay, neuromechanics, neuromuscular motor drive, bilateral deficit, balance, and special populations. Dr. Williams has published several times on these topics, including the authorship of two textbooks. Dr. Williams received his BS and MS from the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, and he earned his PhD from Auburn University.In 2011, Dr. Williams launched the Power Training Program - a collaboration between the Biomechanics Lab and Athletics Department to develop explosive power in athletes. Over 500 student-athletes in over 20 sports and activities have trained for sport-specific power and rehabilitation using Dr. Williams’ strategies and techniques. In addition, over 100 undergraduate exercise science students have worked in the lab as a research team to administer the program.The Power Training Program is unique in the world, using principles and tools in biomechanics, strength and conditioning, and rehabilitation to develop exercise, sequencing, and periodization protocols. What makes it stand apart is the use of responsive kinetic technology. Dr. Williams’ Power Training Program is the only research-quality athlete training program utilizing all of these capabilities for sport-specific power and performance. Research in the Biomechanics Lab has and continues to investigate the effect of responsive kinetics on explosive power, rate of force development, joint stability, balance, and neuromuscular performance.As a result of the success of the Power Training Program, Dr. Williams has consulted with many teams and institutions - including high profile organizations such as the US Olympic Track and Field team, Russian Ministry of Sport, NY Knicks, Sacramento Kings, and Philadelphia Flyers. Each of these organizations use strategies and protocols developed by Dr. Williams in his Power Training Program to meet their individual needs in athlete training, maintenance, and rehabilitation.
Frank Julian - Director of Manufacturing

Mr. Julian, a veteran of the US Army, is also a supply chain management expert. His work history includes hundreds of companies over a diverse range of industries encompassing well-established entities to startups. He founded SBM Inc. in 1993 to help these companies overcome hurdles as they move to the next level by creating efficiency via improving operations, lowering overhead, and developing strategic alliances to expand manufacturing and supply capabilities on a global scale. Mr. Julian is an advocate of virtual outsourcing, which takes advantage of existing manufacturing and fulfillment resources that are more cost effective.

Mr. Julian earned a Bachelor of Science degree with a minor in Business Administration from the University of Massachusetts. He also served in the National Guard based in Worcester, MA, from 1969 to 1971 and the United States Army from 1971 to 1973. He participated in an exchange program with the West German Army, and was honorably discharged E-4.

Al Joyner
The RKS technology is a godsend.”

Al Joyner went to Arkansas State University. He competed with their track and field team throughout his college career. By the time he graduated, Al was a three-time NCAA All-American indoor champion, a three-time NCAA All-American outdoor champion, and a four-time Southland Conference Champ.

In 1984, Al traveled to Los Angeles for the Summer Games to compete with the U.S. Olympic track and field team. With a leap of 56'-7.5"", he became the first African American in 80 years to win a gold medal in the triple jump. Al was also honored with the Jim Thorpe Award, which is given every four years to the best American competitor in an Olympic Field Event.

Al coached Florence Griffith (Flo Jo) to 3 gold medals & 1 silver in the 100, 200,4x 100m relay and 4x400m relay. Al’s sister Jackie Joyner Kersee competed in the heptathlon. When she captured silver in the event, they became the first sibling teammates in U.S. history to medal during the same Olympics.

As the Jump Coach at UCLA, Al won the NCAA 2002 Indoors Track & Field national championships. In addition, while at UCLA, he was the Trainer & Coach of the Fastest Woman Sprinter in the History of Track & Field, the late Florence Griffith Joyner (Flo-Jo), to 2 world and Olympic records, which stills stands today. Al has worked with a host of Professional Players from the NFL, NBA, MBL, Soccer, Olympic and World Championship medalists, National and World record holders, and Collegiate All-Americans. Short Summary
The

Armore™ wearable arm exerciser is the first part of a complete human exoskeleton.  The ultimate goal is to have a suit that can be worn under clothing and strengthen every part of the body.  The knee is in prototype, and the shoulder is on the drawing board.  The more successful
the arm product is, the sooner I can begin advancing and implementing the next parts
of the full Armore exoskeleton.
My name is Steve Cersonsky. I am the inventor
and developer of the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser.
Here’s how it came about.  My daughter says that all I do is sit at my computer.   I was always
envious of those who had the time, self-confidence, and inclination to body
build.  I love science, and thought there might be a way to solve this
problem.  Science fact: Work, as in overcoming friction and weight, builds
muscle.
I set out to design a machine
that would:
<ul>
<li>Allow my
hands to be free. (That eliminated conventional weights.)
<li>Be lightweight,
durable, and washable.
<li>Be low
profile, so it could be comfortably worn under clothing while I was
working.
<li>Be simple to
use –– something I could just slip on in the morning and wear all day, if
I wanted.
• Be affordable.
That was the beginning of the
Armore™ wearable arm exerciser, a resistance training exoskeleton. I spent many
months designing and redesigning the arm exerciser. When I finished, the end
result was a lightweight (under 7 ounces) exerciser that emulated pressing up
to 50 pounds.
My board of directors, several
consultants, and advisors come from the fitness, medical, and business world
volunteered time to help perfect the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser and its
functionality.
Originally designed for people who hate to exercise!
...  You don’t like to exercise. It’s boring torture.
...
You are embarrassed, or have no time, or don’t want
an expensive membership to a fitness club.
...
And your typical New Year’s Resolution to get in
shape lasts about a day.
That’s okay. You sound exactly like me: A desk potato. I never had the time to exercise or join a gym. And
when I did, I hated it. After a few weeks, my best of intentions evaporated. It
was an expensive waste of money.
Meet the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser.
Here’s what it does…
The Armore™ wearable arm exerciser is an exoskeleton trainer
that provides upper arm strengthening. A wearable exerciser weighing only 7
ounces, you can experience up to 50 pounds of resistance. That produces the
same benefit as if you were at a gym using free weights.
The Armore™ wearable arm exerciser works for you anywhere, anytime. Simply slip it on in the
morning (hidden under your clothing, too, if you’re on your way to work).  Adjust the amount of resistance you want, and
your workout begins immediately. Every time you move,
you’re exercising!
All
you have to do is remember to put it on! Wear it around the house. Whether
you’re typing on your computer, sitting on the couch watching television,  texting
on your smart phone, walking to the water cooler, or doing laundry, the
anatomically-correct and efficient Armore™ wearable arm exerciser:
·
Strengthens your entire upper arm including biceps, triceps,
cartilage, ligaments, tendons, and bone
·
Burns away fat and tones your arms (even at low settings)
·
Enhances your performance as it builds strength and endurance
·
Stimulates repetitive muscle activity throughout the body
·
Strengthens connective tissue, bone, and muscle
·
Allows your hands to remain free to take care of your daily
tasks
·
Helps you maintain your fitness regimen because your fitness
regimen goes with you wherever you go
·
And much more!
I use it every day. Whether I’m at my desk, working in the
yard, washing the car, or working on the computer, IT WORKS! That’s why I guarantee it.
Use the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser routinely
for four weeks. If you don’t realize the benefits of the arm exerciser or
obtain bicep growth, return it to me for full refund.
But I know if you use Armore™ wearable arm exerciser, you will like it! Because all
you have to do is put it on! Whenever
you’re wearing the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser, you’re exercising.
It’s easy to use…
First time setup
You can
wear the Armore™ wearable arm resistance training exoskeleton all day. Without
consciously thinking about exercise, you are strengthening your muscles,
tendons, cartilage, and bones.
Once
the Armore™ arm exerciser is properly adjusted, always start by opening the
exerciser to its fully extended position. Then slip your arm into the Armore™
arm exerciser. Once set up, you should only need to tighten the top of the
upper-arm cuff and wrist cuff. The over-the-forearm cuff should be already
adjusted. Watch the video.
Adjusting the amount of resistance
The Armore™ wearable arm exerciser has four (4) knobs, two
on each side of your elbow. Increasing the tightness of the knobs increases the
amount of resistance. Fully tightened, it achieves the equivalent of pressing
about 50 pounds. Watch the video below for complete instructions. Even when
worn under clothing, it’s easy to adjust the tension knobs. Watch the video.
Releasing the Armore™ arm exerciser
To release the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser, extend your
arm fully. Release the upper arm cuff and the top of the wrist cuff. You should
not need to release or adjust the forearm cuff or the bottom of the cuffs. Carefully
fold the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser and return it to its nylon storage
pouch.
Meet the
Inventor
My name is Steven Cersonsky.
I’m the inventor of the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser. I invented it because I
hate exercising and always have.
In 2009, I had a business partner who was 6’
2” tall and weighed 220 pounds. He was in great shape. While I was at my desk
chomping on a burger and fries for lunch, trying to solve another engineering design
problem, he’d be working out at a fitness center, miles from our office.
He was always trying to pull me out of my
chair and go to his gym. I wanted to get in shape, but I had little time,
inclination, or self-confidence to go to the gym. For me, working out was torture.
From time to time, I’d concede to go. The only way I would ever enjoy working
out was when I didn’t have to think about it, such as a competitive game.
I tried water aerobics for a brief time
because of the extra resistance it provided without additional strain on my
body. But that didn’t do it for me, either. Boring.
I decided I’d try to lift weights at my
desk. I quickly realized I couldn’t use my computer and lift weights at the
same time. The weights just sat on the floor in the corner gathering dust. So I
looked for an alternative to weights.
As a sci-fi and science buff, I’d always
been fascinated with gravity. Muscles are the biological way that we overcome
gravity. So, with this knowledge, and the science of increased resistance, repetitive
weight lifting, and water exercise, I came up with an idea and a design. I
began to construct my first prototype. In 2009 I filed for the first
patent using a prototype made of duct tape, lug nuts, painting sticks, and
other items that were readily available.
Six years of experimentation and remodeling
have brought the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser and me to where we are today.
With today’s knowledge that repetition is better than heavy weights,
I continue to build muscles and tendons without strain from heavy
weights.  And it turns out that there are many other benefits from this
type of exercise.  Increased endurance,
blood flow, and the general strengthening of the connective tissue and bone.
Compared to my early prototypes, the Armore™
wearable arm exerciser of today is very comfortable and made of quality
materials –– most of which weren’t available 20 years ago. The Armore™
exerciser I want to send to you is made of glass-infused nylon, a crank-down
device is made out of nickel, gaskets and washers made out of BUMA (a high tech
type of synthetic rubber for longevity and maximum friction), and neoprene
straps with Velcro fasteners.
The Armore™ wearable arm exerciser weighs
only 7 ounces. It can be adjusted up to 50 pounds of resistance –– while you’re
sitting at your desk, grocery shopping, or watching TV. Every time you move,
you’re exercising! Order yours today.
Take the Armore™ wearable
arm exerciser seriously
As you can imagine, I had a number of friends using the
Armore™ wearable arm exerciser during its development. My friends who were younger,
more athletic and muscular benefited even more than me from wearing it on a
regular basis. One of my friends confessed that he felt he was being “beat up”
by the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser because of the additional resistance during
his workout. His increased results were because he cranked the resistance to
max.  So much so, I was surprised he didn’t
break it!
THE
SCIENCE
the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser
Muscles
come in pairs.
When one muscle of a pair contracts, its counterpart muscle contracts
and pulls in the opposite direction. Without this arrangement you wouldn't be
able to straighten your arm after lifting it.
When your biceps muscle in your upper arm contracts, it pulls
your lower arm in towards your shoulder. When it relaxes, your biceps can’t
push your arm back out. To do this, your triceps muscle, the muscles on the underneath
of your upper arm, contract to straighten your arm out. If your triceps muscle
wasn't there, your arm couldn’t straighten. You’d be unable to extend your arm.
My body builder friends look the way they do because of the amount of time, number of repetitions, and weight they lift and, of course, this works for them because of their strong commitment.

Most of us, however, don’t have the time or that level of commitment. We just want to be healthy, keep our body in shape, and looking our best.  So how does one achieve this?   When you lift free weights or work out with commercial
fitness center equipment, the weight itself is what taxes the biceps and the triceps
muscles (one pulling, the other relaxing). The more the weight or resistance,
the greater the muscle strength needed to overcome it.  Adding resistance to your natural movement is how Armore™ wearable arm exerciser works.
Scientifically engineered and weighing in at only 7 ounces,
the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser provides similar results as lifting and
pushing free weights or using commercial fitness center equipment.
But it does so in the most convenient way –– because you wear
it anywhere, anytime… and because it’s adjustable up to 50 pounds of
resistance. All you have to do is remember to put in on.  Every time you move,
you’re exercising!
STORE
Armore Fitness Store
<h2>Armore<span>™ wearable arm exerciser is all you
need to strengthen muscles, burn fat, and tone your arms… anywhere, anytime!
The
items in our Armore™ store are great additions to the success of your fitness
program and use of your Armore™ arm exerciser. For phone orders, call 877
4-ARMORE.

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FUbLK925Yqzk%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
<h3>What We Need &amp
We’re
looking to raise $59,000. Your investment of $59.00 or more buys you two (2)
Armore™ wearable arm exercisers and earns you our most sincere gratitude.
We’re
also looking to connect with fitness centers and trainers in the U.S. for beta
testing the Armore™ wearable arm exerciser in those environments. For an
investment of $290.00, we’ll send 10 Armore™ arm exerciser to a fitness center
or trainer. This would require some reporting, monitoring bicep size and muscle
tone, resolution of pain or reduction of the occurrence of pain on the part of
the fitness centers or trainers. We’d also be looking for testimonials from
those who are most successful with the arm exerciser. (It’s not complicated. Mostly,
success is based on frequency and consistency of wearing the exerciser.)
If
we fail to reach our goal of $59,000, we’ll use those funds in two ways. First,
contribute to physiology research and use some funds for future R&amp
Second, while our ultimate goal is a full-body exoskeleton, our next step is a
knee exerciser. Some funds will be used for R&amp
The Impact
Fitness.
Health. Mind-body balance. Personal wellbeing. They are priorities for many
Americans. The Armore™ wearable arm exerciser is a great solution for those who
want to stay in shape but are constantly on the go and don’t have or take the time
to maintain a regular fitness regimen.
The
Armore™ wearable arm exerciser can do that. Our tests with prototypes showed an
average ¼ inch bicep growth per week for people who used the exerciser for
three 3 weeks. Athletes often added 4-times that, depending on amount of time
used.
<h3>Risks &amp
With
30-plus years of experience as a developer, project manager, engineer, and
inventor, I know that things don’t always go as planned.
While
there have been setbacks along the way in the development of the Armore™
wearable arm exerciser, each and every challenge was met and overcome. Three
reasons: I am a problem solver. I’m persistent as all get out. And it’s what
inventors do. We know there’s an answer. We just haven’t found it yet.

STORE
Armore Fitness Store
Armore™ wearable arm exerciser is all you
need to strengthen muscles, burn fat, and tone your arms… anywhere, anytime!
The
items in our Armore™ store are great additions to the success of your fitness
program and use of your Armore™ arm exerciser. For phone orders, call 877
4-ARMORE.
What We Need & What You Get
We’re
looking to raise $59,000. Your investment of $59.00 or more buys you two (2)
Armore™ wearable arm exercisers and earns you our most sincere gratitude.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t contribute financially, you certainly can
help Armore LLC find its rightful place as an emerging company dedicated to
fitness and health. Here’s how:
Help us get the word out.
Tell your friends.
Follow us on Facebook.
Take a look at our website at ArmoreFitness.com. Sign up

mission.

THE BARBELL BOX is a fitness inspired monthly surprise and
the smartest way to discover your new favourite supplements and fitness gear. Every month, THE BARBELL BOX will
deliver an all-inclusive set of supplements and gym gear for you to test out as
you wage war with the weights in the gym. Whether you're a weekend warrior or a
seasoned gym rat THE BARBELL BOX has
something for everyone. Each month's box will remain a surprise until you rip
it open like a kid on Christmas morning to discover the latest supplements
released to the market and the best gym gear to help you surpass that last PR.
Here at THE BARBELL BOX, we LOVE
working out and staying fit. Day in and day out you can find us in the gym
grinding it out and striving to be better than we were yesterday.
Working in the supplement and fitness industry we have
always had the insight into which supplements work and which ones don't, which
ones taste good and which ones don't. Thats how we got the idea to start THE BARBELL BOX. The
fitness industry can be very confusing. How do you know which supplements work
and which supplements don't? Well now you don't have to! We will take the
guessing work out of the equation for you and send you a custom curated box of
the latest and greatest supplements and fitness gear to your door every month!
We're reaching out to Indigogo fans hoping you'll
join our journey of physical fitness and well being. Be one of the first to
sign up for THE BARBELL BOX prelaunch on
our website here (www.thebarbellbox.com)

and we will enter you for a chance to win a lifetime subscription. 

Like us on

Facebook (www.facebook.com/TheBarbellBox), 

Follow us onTwitter (www.twitter.com/TheBarbellBox) and 

Follow us on Instagram (www.instagram.com/thebarbellbox) 

Our
website has already launched and we are looking to open subscriptions for early
December with a January delivery date. In the meantime we're looking for you to

be a part of our product development team. We want you to share our page and let the world know what great things are coming from THE BARBELL BOX. We want to hear your ideas and even follow up with you after your first shipment. What did you like and dislike
about your first box? What would you like to see in future boxes? Come Join Us!

seasoned gym rat THE BARBELL BOX has
something for everyone. Each month's box will remain a surprise until you rip
it open like a kid on Christmas morning to discover the latest supplements
released to the market and the best gym gear to help you surpass that last PR.
Here at THE BARBELL BOX, we LOVE
working out and staying fit. Day in and day out you can find us in the gym
grinding it out and striving to be better than we were yesterday.
Working in the supplement and fitness industry we have
always had the insight into which supplements work and which ones don't, which
ones taste good and which ones don't. Thats how we got the idea to start THE BARBELL BOX. The
fitness industry can be very confusing. How do you know which supplements work
and which supplements don't? Well now you don't have to! We will take the
guessing work out of the equation for you and send you a custom curated box of
the latest and greatest supplements and fitness gear to your door every month!
We're reaching out to Indigogo fans hoping you'll
join our journey of physical fitness and well being. Be one of the first to
sign up for THE BARBELL BOX prelaunch on
our website here (www.thebarbellbox.com)
and we will enter you for a chance to win a lifetime subscription. Like us on
Facebook (www.facebook.com/TheBarbellBox), Follow us onTwitter (www.twitter.com/TheBarbellBox) and Follow us on Instagram (www.instagram.com/thebarbellbox) Our
website has already launched and we are looking to open subscriptions for early
December with a January delivery date. In the meantime we're looking for you to

be a part of our product development team. We want you to share our page and let the world know what great things are coming from THE BARBELL BOX. We want to hear your ideas and even follow up with you after your first shipment. What did you like and dislike
about your first box? What would you like to see in future boxes? Come Join Us!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: <div>
Q: What health regulations does Bluvos meet?
A: Bluvos is manufactured in a cGMP facility, and is legal to sell in the USA as a dietary supplement. We are currently in the process of acquiring our Natural Product Number with Health Canada.
Q: How does Bluvos differ from energy drinks?
A: Bluvos is the healthy choice. We removed the Sugars, flavorings and Preservatives that are in most energy drinks, and added Nootropics for a cognitive boost!

column4: >Q: How and when can I purchase Bluvos?

column1: A:Right now, on Indiegogo!! Find a perk you like!
Q: Can I take Bluvos with coffee?
A: Of course! We would never ask someone to give up coffee.
Q: Will Bluvos cause me to crash after it wears off?
A: We have had no reported feedback of a crash! This is (most likely) because there is no sugar.
Q: Is Bluvos just for gaming or can I use it in other activities?
A: You can use Bluvos for anything that requires Energy and Focus!
Q: Why did you create Bluvos?

A: We wanted a product that we could use safely every day, that was healthy and would boost energy/ focus. We personally didn’t drink energy drinks because they made us feel sick, and there was nothing on the market that provided clean energy with a cognitive boost.
Q: What are Nootropics and why are they in Bluvos?
A: Nootropics are a class of substance that boost cognitive function. We added Nootropics to Bluvos so that it would provide a Cognitive Boost as well as Energy!

column4: >Q: How much Bluvos can I safely consume in a day?

column1: A: We recommend 2 pills daily. Some people find that 1 pill is enough!
Q: Will your pills be blue?

A: Yes, we are working on finding a natural blue dye for our capsules!

Q: Does Bluvos have any side effects with my medical condition and/or medication?

A: We have chosen ingredients that generally have a low chance of causing ill effects with medical conditions. However, it's important to always consult with a healthcare provider before taking any dietary supplements.
