SnoreTech Web Site
New technologies make it possible to attain certain things,
which were previously out of reach. For example, without any surgery, we now
can affect muscles deep inside your mouth, prevent them from vibrating during
sleep, and make them stop producing the snoring sound.
We have developed a small, intelligent training device for
your soft palate muscles, which plugs right into your smartphone. Within couple
of weeks of fun training exercises, your snoring would go away for many months
or for a year depending on how severe your condition was.

Try it out! 

The ""SNOR"" Device

Here is the actual photo of the device in it's current form. At this point we are waiting on packaging materials for he first small batch of our product. 

Our Goal
Certain problems in our life are very hard to get over. Snoring
is one of them. There has been a lot of effort, time, and money invested into
finding a solution for snoring
column2: however, the results have not been very

column1: significant or effective.
Our team has developed a new approach to eliminating snoring
symptoms. We have earned a utility patent for our method, which means that we
are taking a completely new approach and it promises to be successful. We would
like for over 90 million Americans who snore and especially for their loved
ones to get a relief and enjoy a peaceful sleep. We have developed the “SNOR”
device to take on such goal. At this moment, we are taking the last steps in

making our technology available to anybody who needs it.

How Does it Work?
Snoring appears due to the relaxation and the vibration of the
soft palate muscles located deep inside your mouth cavity. The weakness of the
soft palate muscles causes them to vibrate and physically produce the snoring
sound during sleep. If the soft palate muscles are strong and toned, the
vibration goes away and snoring disappears. Our “SNOR” device is an
“electronic fitness coach” which targets the soft palate muscles and makes them
stronger and tighter.
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Snoring sound is physically created by vibration of a soft

column1: palate muscle (SPM). SPM are thin and flat muscles with one of its edges freely
hanging inside your mouth cavity. The function of this muscle is to block the
nasal passages from the inside of your mouth cavity so that food does not get
into your nose when you swallow (Image 1)
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >When the SPM are weak (Image 2), they relax during sleep and sag

column1: more than they should. As the air from your breath passes in and out, it makes
them vibrate similar to how a flag ripples in the wind, emitting the sound,
which we know as ""snoring” (Image 3).
IN ORDER TO DEFEAT SNORING, YOU MUST STRENGTHEN AND TIGHTEN THE
SOFT PALATE MUSCLES
In order for any muscle to become strong, you have to train
them. That means you have to load a muscle multiple times and repeat the
procedure on daily basis. This rule is no different for your soft palate
muscles
column2: however, the process is more complex. The first thing that you may ask

column1: is: “How can I learn to activate and flex my soft palate muscles?” We have
designed “SNOR” so that anybody could easily train those muscles. You will be
following the directions of the device and see how your muscles are performing
on the screen of your smartphone in real time.
As easy as 1, 2, 3!
Setting up and using our “SNOR” device is very easy. Simply
follow the instructions on your smartphone screen and you will complete the
session in 10 minutes.
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Install the “SNOR” app into your smartphone and plug the device

column1: in.
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Connect the headphones to the “SNOR” device and insert the tube

column1: into the opening on the device.
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Launch the app and start the training procedure!

column1: Soft palate muscles engage intensively when you perform a
sucking effort through a tube. There is a tube that attaches to our “SNOR”
device. The tube has to be positioned inside your mouth in a specific way and
you need to make an effort similar to drinking liquid through a straw. The
tube needs to be positioned deep inside your mouth
be performed by the cheek muscles, instead of the soft palate muscles. In order
to position the tube correctly, it is marked at the point where your lips

should be placed.

The soft palate muscles activate and you can see how well you
are tensing them on the screen of your smartphone.
""SNOR"" sets a individualized training program and
displays how your muscles are performing in a form of a graph on your
smartphone screen. The graph serves as a reference as to how you are performing

the exercise in real time. This method is called ""biofeedback"".

 Apart from demonstrating the graph of your soft palate
muscles activity, ""SNOR"" uses a number of multimedia stimuli (movies,
videos, images) in order to reward you for your good effort. Such process makes

using our device simple and pleasurable.


 ""SNOR"" also saves all of your progress and you
can review it at any time.
Within 2-weeks time you or your partner will notice that you are
snoring a lot less. In time the snoring will completely disappear. The standard

length of the course is 20 sessions. Each session takes 10 minutes.

 Timeline
<b style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
History
The idea for this device had first appeared in 2001. The first
version of the patent has been filed on that same year. Because we were
patenting the idea and not a specific device we had to prove the novelty of the
method. However, we had no experience in writing patents back then so our
patent had to be rewritten and revised several times. Finally, we have been
rewarded for our work and in 2013 the patent had been passed and published
Right about the same time we have started developing first
prototypes of the device. The first devices were larger and more cumbersome as
they were designed to connect to a PC. One of the major hurdles with our early
devices was the quality and reliability of the sensors.
At one point we have decided to miniaturize the device as the
smartphones were finally at the level where we could use them for our purposes.
The biggest problem was the compatibility with the Android devices. Since every
smartphone manufacturer has their own version of Android software and voltage
supply through the phone jack, we had to revise the original prototype several
times. We have redesigned the unit from ground-up 3 times and managed to sort out
all of the compatibility issues with Android smartphones. Below are the
previous versions of the device:
Spending a lot of our personal resources on patenting,
hardware/software development and testing we ended up coming to IndieGoGo for
help with launching the product to the mass market.
That being said, this is more than a money-making business for
us. This is the opportunity to bring something positive into this world and to
improve the quality of life for a lot of people.
Risks and Challenges

With your help, we can start the mass production of the “SNOR” device and set up the distribution infrastructure. Without your contribution, we would grow too slowly and there is a possibility we may delay this project indefinitely due to the lack of capital.

All the electronic components, the circuit boards have been fully tested. We have gone through several prototypes to iron out the compatibility problems with various smartphones and reached the final, fully functional design.

We are working with a reputable, US based manufacturer. We need your support to pay for the first batch of “SNOR” devices, for the packaging, advertising, and to continue paying the programmers working on our web site.
We work hard so you, our backers, can be the first to use our great product at lowest cost. Our goal is to start shipping first “SNOR” devices at the end of August 2015.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
What sort of proof can you present that your “SNOR” device is effective?
The link below has several studies confirming that even the indirect activation of the soft palate muscles has great, positive effect on removing the snoring symptoms:
http://www.snoretech.com/content/6-how-does-snor-device-work#proof
What does “weakened soft palate muscles” mean?
Weakened means that the muscles are too soft or too thin
column2: thus, lacking a muscular strength making them likely to sag. Those muscles dribble under the stream of air from your breath and physically produce the vocal snoring sound.

column1: Are there any prescription drugs that can make those muscles stronger without any training?

No, there are none. Even the known anabolic steroids make a muscle bigger only if you intensively train it.
If you are not looking to put in a certain physical effort and your lifestyle goes against regular physical exercise, the “SNOR” device might not be for you. There are plenty of other offers on the Internet, which will not ask anything from you other than your credit card number.

I know that in order for a muscle to become larger and tighter, it needs to be loaded with a lot of weight. For example, if I train my biceps, the weight of a dumbbell corresponds with how hard my muscle is working. How will I know if the muscles of my soft palate are getting a good workout?

This is exactly what “SNOR” device accomplishes. When you making a sucking effort, you activate and load your soft palate muscles and create vacuum inside the tube, which is connected to the device. The device has a built in pressure sensor, which takes a reading and sends it to your smartphone. This way you are able to see how hard your soft palate muscles are tensing. The more you tense your soft palate muscles, the more vacuum you create inside the tube. Respectively, the graph on the screen of your smartphone rises higher. In the medical field, we call this method “biofeedback”.
What am I going to feel when my soft palate muscles start getting stronger?

Most likely, you will not feel any different. The snoring will not start disappearing right away either. You will start seeing the result after you finalize 10-15 complete sessions with the device. The “complete” session implies that you are performing the exercise at your full ability and tensing your soft palate muscles as hard as you can. You have to put some effort into it.
Is it possible that snoring comes back?

Yes, it is possible. After you have completed your soft palate muscles training and the snoring has disappeared, your muscles will eventually start losing its strength and tightness. Keep in mind that it is a slow process. It could take months or a year before your soft palate muscles would weaken enough to produce snoring. That being said, you can complete another course of training exercises with “SNOR” device and your soft palate muscle will restore it’s “anti-snoring” qualities.
The Team
We are a father/son team. We work with talented teams of software programmers and hardware engineers to assist us with our product development.

column1: Neurophysiology: 1977 –
medical technologies 1990 – Present .
","SnoreTech Web Site
New technologies make it possible to attain certain things,
which were previously out of reach. For example, without any surgery, we now
can affect muscles deep inside your mouth, prevent them from vibrating during
sleep, and make them stop producing the snoring sound.
We have developed a small, intelligent training device for
your soft palate muscles, which plugs right into your smartphone. Within couple
of weeks of fun training exercises, your snoring would go away for many months
or for a year depending on how severe your condition was.
Try it out! The ""SNOR"" DeviceHere is the actual photo of the device in it's current form. At this point we are waiting on packaging materials for he first small batch of our product. Our Goal
Certain problems in our life are very hard to get over. Snoring
is one of them. There has been a lot of effort, time, and money invested into
finding a solution for snoring
column2: however, the results have not been very

column1: significant or effective.
Our team has developed a new approach to eliminating snoring
symptoms. We have earned a utility patent for our method, which means that we
are taking a completely new approach and it promises to be successful. We would
like for over 90 million Americans who snore and especially for their loved
ones to get a relief and enjoy a peaceful sleep. We have developed the “SNOR”
device to take on such goal. At this moment, we are taking the last steps in
making our technology available to anybody who needs it.How Does it Work?
Snoring appears due to the relaxation and the vibration of the
soft palate muscles located deep inside your mouth cavity. The weakness of the
soft palate muscles causes them to vibrate and physically produce the snoring
sound during sleep. If the soft palate muscles are strong and toned, the
vibration goes away and snoring disappears. Our “SNOR” device is an
“electronic fitness coach” which targets the soft palate muscles and makes them
stronger and tighter.
Snoring sound is physically created by vibration of a soft
palate muscle (SPM). SPM are thin and flat muscles with one of its edges freely
hanging inside your mouth cavity. The function of this muscle is to block the
nasal passages from the inside of your mouth cavity so that food does not get
into your nose when you swallow (Image 1)
When the SPM are weak (Image 2), they relax during sleep and sag
more than they should. As the air from your breath passes in and out, it makes
them vibrate similar to how a flag ripples in the wind, emitting the sound,
which we know as ""snoring” (Image 3).
IN ORDER TO DEFEAT SNORING, YOU MUST STRENGTHEN AND TIGHTEN THE
SOFT PALATE MUSCLES
In order for any muscle to become strong, you have to train
them. That means you have to load a muscle multiple times and repeat the
procedure on daily basis. This rule is no different for your soft palate
muscles
column2: however, the process is more complex. The first thing that you may ask

column1: is: “How can I learn to activate and flex my soft palate muscles?” We have
designed “SNOR” so that anybody could easily train those muscles. You will be
following the directions of the device and see how your muscles are performing
on the screen of your smartphone in real time.
As easy as 1, 2, 3!
Setting up and using our “SNOR” device is very easy. Simply
follow the instructions on your smartphone screen and you will complete the
session in 10 minutes.
Install the “SNOR” app into your smartphone and plug the device
in.
Connect the headphones to the “SNOR” device and insert the tube
into the opening on the device.
Launch the app and start the training procedure!
Soft palate muscles engage intensively when you perform a
sucking effort through a tube. There is a tube that attaches to our “SNOR”
device. The tube has to be positioned inside your mouth in a specific way and
you need to make an effort similar to drinking liquid through a straw. The
tube needs to be positioned deep inside your mouth
be performed by the cheek muscles, instead of the soft palate muscles. In order
to position the tube correctly, it is marked at the point where your lips
should be placed.The soft palate muscles activate and you can see how well you
are tensing them on the screen of your smartphone.
SNOR"" sets a individualized training program and
displays how your muscles are performing in a form of a graph on your
smartphone screen. The graph serves as a reference as to how you are performing
the exercise in real time. This method is called ""biofeedback"". Apart from demonstrating the graph of your soft palate
muscles activity, ""SNOR"" uses a number of multimedia stimuli (movies,
videos, images) in order to reward you for your good effort. Such process makes
using our device simple and pleasurable. ""SNOR"" also saves all of your progress and you
can review it at any time.
Within 2-weeks time you or your partner will notice that you are
snoring a lot less. In time the snoring will completely disappear. The standard
length of the course is 20 sessions. Each session takes 10 minutes. Timeline
Development
History
The idea for this device had first appeared in 2001. The first
version of the patent has been filed on that same year. Because we were
patenting the idea and not a specific device we had to prove the novelty of the
method. However, we had no experience in writing patents back then so our
patent had to be rewritten and revised several times. Finally, we have been
rewarded for our work and in 2013 the patent had been passed and published
(US Patent # 8460159).
Right about the same time we have started developing first
prototypes of the device. The first devices were larger and more cumbersome as
they were designed to connect to a PC. One of the major hurdles with our early
devices was the quality and reliability of the sensors.
At one point we have decided to miniaturize the device as the
smartphones were finally at the level where we could use them for our purposes.
The biggest problem was the compatibility with the Android devices. Since every
smartphone manufacturer has their own version of Android software and voltage
supply through the phone jack, we had to revise the original prototype several
times. We have redesigned the unit from ground-up 3 times and managed to sort out
all of the compatibility issues with Android smartphones. Below are the
previous versions of the device:

hardware/software development and testing we ended up coming to IndieGoGo for
help with launching the product to the mass market.
That being said, this is more than a money-making business for

improve the quality of life for a lot of people.

Short Summary

A 7.8 magnitude earthquake struck Nepal on April 25th.  Entire villages were buried. 1,000’s died as large parts of the capital Kathmandu collapsed.  In the countryside, the death toll is unknown and unimaginable. International aid and relief  teams have descended on Nepal to help rebuild shattered lives. Yet  funding has reduced to a ""trickle"".  Right after the earthquake hit, causing 8,000 deaths and leaving 8.1 million people in need of humanitarian assistance, there was an outpouring of emergency funding.  But The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) says it has received only $92 million of the $423 million requested via a flash appeal on May 11. By contrast, The International Organization for Migration (IOM) pointed out that $735 Million had been committed within a month of the 2010 earthquake in Haiti. When a typhoon hit the Philippines in 2013, $275 million was committed within the same time period.  Without funding, IOM's contractors would have to stop clearing rubble and medical assistance to those in need would cease.  Supplies to build temporary shelters would be severely curtailed, leaving tens of thousands of families with only tarps and plastic sheets to protect them.  Those living in remote areas are likely to face increasing shortages of supplies such as rice, tarpaulins and medicine. In addition, education has been severely curtailed.  Over 24,000 classrooms have been damaged or destroyed by the earthquake and there is a desperate need to set up alternative learning spaces for children. Medical attention is imperative at this time. Resources are scarce as many are trying to rebuild hospitals and provide safer environments to receive medical care. Doctors, Nurses and Medical Staff are working around the clock trying to treat many that have fallen ill, if not terminally ill.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<div>

I need to get to Nepal to help provide support. By nature, the Nepali people are a selfless group that expect nothing for the outside world. They only give. I have been lucky enough to be humbled by such a caring and generous environment. I need to raise money so that I can provide support and give back to a country that has given me so much.

I am traveling with an NGO called Projects Abroad. Projects Abroad has worked in Nepal since 1999 and has long standing relationships  with many organizations in Chitwan, Kathmandu, The Kathmandu Valley and Ghandruk, especially with schools, children’s homes and hospitals.  On June 2015, Projects Abroad began giving volunteers the opportunity to help with vital relief efforts on their Disaster Relief Project.  This relief effort will last as long as needed.

The immediate objectives of the Disaster Relief projects are firstly to help some of the tens of thousands of children whose schools have been damaged return to school.  Over 24,000 classrooms have been damaged or destroyed by the earthquake and there is a desperate need to set up alternative learning spaces.Volunteers will also be helping to teach and care for the children in these temporary schools as well as re-building and renovating schools to help make them safe places to return to.  The Relief project is initially focusing on rural and semi-rural areas in the Kathmandu Valley.

Hospitals are in dire need of attention as all hands are on deck rebuilding. Medical stations have been in place in many areas where thousands of families have remained homeless. Many are suffering from infection from injuries sustained during the earthquake. Others are falling ill due to the monsoon season and contaminated water sources. Many do not have access to electricity, showers, warm food or clean water.
The Project will expand into other regions as work is completed and participation grows. The only way to do that is to provide funding and lend a hand.
A Bit About Me

I am a 26 year old EMT in Boston, Massachusetts. I have 7 years of experience in Wilderness Emergency Medicine, with certifications in Search and Rescue and Wilderness Advanced Life Support. I am working towards a career in International Emergency Medicine by applying to a Nurse Practitioner graduate school program. International work in this field will help me build a better relationship with people in need under dire circumstances. It will also give me experience to draw me closer to a more communal aspect in this line of work. It is important for me to travel abroad to learn about and expand medical organizations for countries in need.
<div>
<div> <span style=""font-size: 24px
<div>
<div>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Since Projects Abroad does not receive any government funding, they have to charge a price for their projects.  As a volunteer, therefore, I will have to pay a placement fee which covers all standard costs such as my food and accommodation, health and travel insurance, airports transfers, as well as all project materials.

column1: This fee will not only support me, but will help support Projects Abroad.The money goes directly into support for volunteers, implementing and monitoring of projects, awareness, communication and advice, direct costs on the ground and operating and administrative costs.

By supporting me, you are helping me get the direct hands-on experience I need to help define my goal of a career in International Emergency Medicine and will help with graduate schools admissions. It will also allow me to see the physical and emotional challenges of medical relief work up close.

I will be starting in Kathmandu where I will be involved in working along side of doctors and nurses providing immediate emergency and long term care to the sick and injured. I will be working with children and adults alike in intensive care units and labor units. When I am not working in the hospitals, I will be working along side of many to help rebuild schools and homes to provide safe places for displaced families.
Funding

I am asking you all for $3500.00. It seems like a lot but with the power of social media I believe we can reach this goal together. $1500 goes towards my flight. The rest of the money will be paid in full to Projects Abroad as the organization not only supports me, but helps the entire staff I am working with. With that being said, I would love to go past this goal and provide extra funding for this organization.
ANYTHING HELPS!! Whether it is a $10 contribution or a $200 contribution, it all helps fight for many in need.

The risks and challenges that we will be facing are hardships that the people face every day. Roads are closed as landslides cripplethe region blocking support routes to villages. Far too many citizens are falling ill due to contaminated water supply and shortages of food, supplies and housing. Thousands are desperate and enter into the hospital each day and it us up to the doctors and volunteers to treat these patients.
Other Ways You Can Help

It is ok if you can not contribute financially at this time! All that I ask is that you share this campaign. Help me make some noise about this issue. The news is no longer covering the suffering in Nepal, so this is the most important time to raise awareness. Please help put this country back on forefront and help get this country the funding and support it deserves.
From the bottom of my heart, thank you. In any way you can and will support, thank you.

The Impact

Since Projects Abroad does not receive any government funding, they have to charge a price for their projects.  As a volunteer, therefore, I will have to pay a placement fee which covers all standard costs such as my food and accommodation, health and travel insurance, airports transfers, as well as all project materials.

This fee will not only support me, but will help support Projects Abroad.The money goes directly into support for volunteers, implementing and monitoring of projects, awareness, communication and advice, direct costs on the ground and operating and administrative costs.

By supporting me, you are helping me get the direct hands-on experience I need to help define my goal of a career in International Emergency Medicine and will help with graduate schools admissions. It will also allow me to see the physical and emotional challenges of medical relief work up close.

I will be starting in Kathmandu where I will be involved in working along side of doctors and nurses providing immediate emergency and long term care to the sick and injured. I will be working with children and adults alike in intensive care units and labor units. When I am not working in the hospitals, I will be working along side of many to help rebuild schools and homes to provide safe places for displaced families.
Funding

I am asking you all for $3500.00. It seems like a lot but with the power of social media I believe we can reach this goal together. $1500 goes towards my flight. The rest of the money will be paid in full to Projects Abroad as the organization not only supports me, but helps the entire staff I am working with. With that being said, I would love to go past this goal and provide extra funding for this organization.
ANYTHING HELPS!! Whether it is a $10 contribution or a $200 contribution, it all helps fight for many in need.
Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges that we will be facing are hardships that the people face every day. Roads are closed as landslides cripplethe region blocking support routes to villages. Far too many citizens are falling ill due to contaminated water supply and shortages of food, supplies and housing. Thousands are desperate and enter into the hospital each day and it us up to the doctors and volunteers to treat these patients.

It is ok if you can not contribute financially at this time! All that I ask is that you share this campaign. Help me make some noise about this issue. The critical moment!


This is the moment of
truth in Golf. All the preparation, comes down to this moment when

the ball is reacting to the club-face. Your choice of tee will have an influence.

Design Improvements
I'm Pat O'hara, designer of the D-tee golf tee. Switching from a
cylindrical shaft tee to a blade-like shaft allows for the slimmest
profile of any golf tee when using with the distance drive. Knifing
through the turf and pivoting reduces resistance at that critical
millisecond when the driver is contacting the tee and the ball

simultaneously.

Anatomy of a Divot


The Divot starts with downward force trapping the ball against the turf adding pressure. The ball leaves the club-face with added backspin and loft as the club continues to the low point of the  swing arc. Up flies the patch of fairway!


The Divot Effect


Turn the D-tee 90 degrees
at set up and the D-tee  has a similar effect to the trap and spin
one achieves on a well groomed fairway. Many tee box areas have less
than ideal conditions for achieving the backspin and control one gets
from a groomed fairway. Now you can get
consistent results with your par 3 iron shots even on tee box areas
that haven't been properly watered, mowed or seeded without taking a
divot.
Optimal performance within
the rules of golf are at the heart of the D-tee. If performance is
important to you, you owe it to yourself and your game to try the
best designed tee in golf.

column1: ","Are you tired by buying, learning, using and changing each time the ­applications to manage your different personal data, like documents, passwords, contacts, pictures, videos, TV records, music files, radio stations, events etc.? Don't jump anymore!
BlackFiles – Your unique personal data management software.

The BlackFiles Team: software developers, graphic designers, marketing experts and private computer users are working since two years in optimizing a solution for an effective data management software easily to handle with. We performed many interviews with interested users, presenting them our software concept and also several drafts of the user interface. Finally we found the optimal solution.
BlackFiles – Uniformity, simplicity and security for your data.

BlackFiles is a collection of single applications, called modules, with a common user interface. Each module is treating another class of data. Similar themes are joined in containers, called module packages. We will start with 3 module packages:
BlackFiles/Basics – handling Documents, Passwords and ContactsBlackFiles/Pics – handling Pictures, Videos and TV RecordsBlackFiles/Tunes – handling Music Files, Internet Broadcast Stations and Events
Examples of the modules Documents, Pictures and Music.

The first three module packages mentioned will be separately offered to the private consumers worldwide for a very affordable price.More module packages like BlackFiles/Financings, BlackFiles/Communications, BlackFiles/ePrints, BlackFiles/Social Media etwa will follow.The software will run on Windows©, MacOS©, Android© and iOS© and will be available in Spring 2016 in English, Spanish, German and French.

This are only a few of the BlackFiles' advantages for the user:➜ Same user interface in all modules.➜ Preinstalled category folders and forms.➜ Multilingual menu.➜ Meaningful expansion of the software to the user's needs.➜ Easy synchronization of data with mobile devices.➜ Centralized data management.➜ Encryption of private data.➜ Automatic reminders.➜ Support without restrictions, costs and time limitation.➜ Very affordable price.

The problem: Until now computer users need several applications to manage their digital data. They all have different user interfaces, requiring a lot of time to get familiar with. They are all expensive and need to be constantly updated.
Many applications, many interfaces, many expenses – many drawbacks.

The solution: Imagine a software able to organize any kind of personal data having always the same user interface. The recorded data are password protected and can be stored in private archives. Preinstalled folders and forms enable you to organize the files in an easy way. And of course, the data can be synchronized with mobile devices. This and much more is BlackFiles.
An example of the module Passwords.
An example of a module Contacts form.
An example of the module Pictures edit options.

The present and the future:  Day after day consumers store interesting or personal data using the personal computer. In the future an ever-increasing collection of digital files will be the result. Continuously improved photo and video cameras, scanners, mobile devices, faster internet connections and free web content arouse the consumer's desire to save this data, so that they are always available to him. Therefore he needs a simple and efficient data management – like BlackFiles. The demographic development in industrialized countries means that more older people learn to use computers to take advantage of the possibilities of modern, digital communications. In the future, more and more people will have to deal with an increasing number of private computer data.Summary: BlackFiles is the only software with an universal concept for managing many types of personal computer data and able to close the gap between the most sophisticated, expensive, difficult to handle and overloaded applications and the free applications with inadequate functions, security flaws, confusing interface, lack of synchronization, no user support etc. In other words: They are applications without user affinity.➜ BlackFiles was designed by users for users.➜ BlackFiles is the only software with a global approach and a modular concept.➜ BlackFiles replaces several computer applications.➜ BlackFiles offers preinstalled folders and forms➜ BlackFiles is operating system independent.➜ BlackFiles secures data doubly protected by a password and encrypts it.➜ BlackFiles focuses on the most important functions of a data management.➜ BlackFiles is multilingual.➜ BlackFiles can be expanded to the user's needs.➜ BlackFiles has an uniform and very intuitive user interface.➜ BlackFiles is priced at an unbeatable price.

The software target group are the 1,5 billion users worldwide using their computers primarily for private purposes. Market analyzes, conducted at the beginning of the project, showed an exceptionally strong willingness to buy BlackFiles.

In the medium term BlackFiles should establish itself worldwide as the standard software for the complete private data management – similar to the position of Microsoft Office© for office applications.
The BlackFiles Team believes in this project and will do the very best to achieve this goal.

We analyzed of course the market of data management software and we didn't find any kind of software with such a smart approach like BlackFiles. So BlackFiles will be the first to enter this market of integrated applications.
In the future other software companies could try to imitate our approach, but our time advantage and extended market presence will enable BlackFiles to be leader in this part of the software market.
We'll appreciate you to turn the attention of your friends to our project BlackFiles. The more people supporting BlackFiles, the sooner we'll deliver.",10.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Wiesbaden, Germany",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/blackfiles/pica

Since this campaign is nearly over and I'm still a long way from my goal, I've created a continuation of this campaign on IndieGoGo Life, https://life.indiegogo.com/fundraisers/fitness-for-jesse-stage-2/x/304755

If you're coming here after this campaign ends, please go there to donate.

My name's Jesse. I was diagnosed in 2001 with a degenerative neuromuscular disorder, like a mild form of Lou Gehrig's Disease (ALS). The condition is progressing very slowly, but it has impacted my life in a number of ways. It robs me of energy, and makes it difficult for me to walk. It's also rendered me pretty much unable to work, although I'm attempting to pursue music, photography, and game development careers.

As a result, I'm stuck in my home most of the time, and mostly sedentary. I'm caught in a vicious circle--not being able to exercise means I'm overweight, so it takes more energy to move around and I experience pain in various places, which makes it more difficult to exercise or move around, and the problem builds on itself. I don't have many options for exercising
column2: free options like going for a walk are out of reach for me because of my disability
column3:
I need cardio exercises I can do sitting down. And going to a gym is expensive and tires me out before I even start exercising, plus the local gym is not fully accessible.

I have some space that I would like to turn into a fitness area, but I need some help equipping it. I'm currently looking at 3 pieces of equipment, although I'm not 100% settled on all of them--it depends partly on available funds.

Concept2 Model D or E rower with PM5 computer
column6:
psc=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">http://www.amazon.ca/dp/B00NH9WEUA/ref=wl_it_dp...
This is my top priority, as it gives the best all-round workout. However, it's also the most expensive, and takes up the most space, so I'm not likely to get it first. The Model E is preferable, since it's higher, and so easier for me to get on and off, but the Model D is more available. I've wanted to get one of these for a while, but didn't have the space for it. Now I've moved and I've got the space (although I need to clear some stuff out first), but my living expenses have increased so I can't really afford it.

Schwinn 270 Recumbent
column8:
coliid=I2WF98PA7P0DK0"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">http://www.amazon.ca/dp/B00D4LEEXQ/ref=wl_it_dp...
This is my second priority, but probably my first purchase. It will enable me to develop leg strength, train cardio, and burn calories, with a comfortable seating position that's easily accessible for me.

Sunny Health &
column11:
coliid=I119Q4GSCSZZ65"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">http://www.amazon.ca/dp/B005T4YJ36/ref=wl_it_dp...
This is my lowest priority, as I'll have difficulty getting on and off it, and may need to rig up some sort of stool for the purpose, but it's also the cheapest of the three. It will allow me to train endurance through long rides, as well as fast-twitch muscles through high-cadence spinning. This is a really basic and cheap bike, and I'd like to get a better one if funds permit, that has a computer with programmed workouts, but I don't have a specific one in mind, and again, it depends on how much I can afford. If I go a bit over my goal, but not enough to get something better, I'll be adding SPD-SL pedals, plus SPD-SL shoes for myself and my parents.


You can also help me out by supporting my Patreon, https://www.patreon.com/nAbleMedia?ty=h , which provides me income on a monthly basis for my creative work. I'm also doing long-term crowdfunding campaigns for music gear http://gogetfunding.com/taking-this-show-on-the-road/ and photography gear http://gogetfunding.com/lens-fund-stage-i/ (highest priority items),and http://gogetfunding.com/lens-fund-stage-ii/ (more expensive and lower priority items like medium format digital). But this one is higher priority, and more important, since it's for my health.


Regarding the perks, the ambient album can be listened to and purchased at https://neur0mancer.bandcamp.com/album/soundtrack-of-an-unreleased-film (it's $4 less if purchased through any of my crowdfunding campaigns than if purchased directly from Bandcamp). As for the book, I'm still shooting photos for it, but many of my photos, some of which will be included, can be seen on my 500px profile, https://500px.com/jcfawcett

Who We Are

We are a group of people from Cumbria who want to help the refugees in Calais. People who have risked their lives fleeing from their homes in war-torn countries like Syria, Afghanistan, Darfur or Somalia should not be left abandoned and under attack at the border to Britain. 

We will be delivering a van full of supplies to the refugees in Calais in November.

Why Are We Doing This? 

- The situation for refugees living in 'The Jungle' in Calais is dire. There is a shortage of food, warm clothes, and medicine. There are men, women, children and people with urgent medical needs living in the camp.

- Several people have died in recent months attempting to make the dangerous crossing into Britain. Many of those who survive are often injured and traumatised with no access to medical care.

- Both French and British governments are failing to provide support to the people in need. 

- Asylum is a human right. Britain needs to take its fair share of refugees, especially considering its military interventions in the regions many of these people are fleeing.

- We want to demonstrate solidarity with our fellow human beings and oppose the hate campaign against them in sections of the media and amongst many politicians.

- Human beings are human beings. And when we can help our fellow human beings, we should.

What is the money for?

We are raising money to pay for the cost of the ferry and petrol, and any excess will be used to buy supplies for the refugees.
Your donations will fund emergency relief items such as:
FOOD
Rice, Tuna, Beans, Lentils, Flour, Tea, Long-life Milk, Vegetable Oil
SANITARY ITEMS
Toilet Paper, Wipes, Sanitary Towels, Disinfectant
MEDICINE
Plasters, Bandages
Would you like to help?

Please contact us if you can also fill your car and join the convoy.

As well as donating money, please share this campaign widely on social media and amongst friends and colleagues.
Please consider donating items such as tents, sleeping bags, tarpaulins, men's clothes. Get in touch to arrange collection.
THANK YOU!!!!

Hello. I am Bolor-Erdene.
I am citizen of the mostly air-polluted city in the world, Ulaanbaatar.
In 2015 winter, an incredible event happened to me. I found out that I was pregnant.

I have been living in the most dangerously air polluted area of the city. In 2016 spring, my doctor told me that my baby’s mental development has problem and brain development growth was slower than the normal. The news was indeed shocking and frightening which made me to start asking doctors the reasons for my baby's health problem. Number of women giving birth with lot of health problems with their babies. This number is increasing year by year.

The doctor said the main cause for my baby’s mental and brain development was the air pollution that comes from the unprocessed coal smoke. When I said to the doctor that I had been using cotton mask while I was pregnant, he replied to me that cotton mask is not the way to get over the air pollution.
I really regret that I should have protected myself from the air pollution using the right mask which would have prevented from me giving birth without any problems.
In pharmacies, they mostly sell cotton masks. The usage rate of the right mask against the air pollution is very low, introducing to the public and how to use the right mask was done by no body.

Winter is approaching and the time for heavy air pollution is ahead. It worries me that here are numbers of mothers who have same problems as me and I have been continuously thinking of how to help these mothers. It came to my mind strongly that the first step is to create an awareness of this severe issue and inform them about ways to protect themselves and their babies from air pollution. That is, the solution lies on how mothers could simply make the right choice with right information in-hand at the beginning.

In conclusion, I am currently conducting a project that seeks to deliver 2,000 specially-equipped masks to pregnant mothers. The project aims to inform and educate mothers of the advantages of using the right mask and the severity of air pollution.
Perks
Air pollution and children’s health more information

In our first run, our campaign raised $2789 through the generosity of 45 backers! Thanks for your community-minded consideration in helping us fund the build-out and staffing of a first-of-its’ kind, bilingual Yoga studio with world dance and an in-house healing arts clinic for Watsonville and its’ surrounds! 

With your donation of over $50, you become a valued supporter of positive change in Watsonville, and one of our first and honored guests at the studio when we open in July, with an unlimited monthly pass! If you don't live in Watsonville, you can donate it to a designated friend or family member. 

There are at least 16 Yoga studios in Santa Cruz, Capitola, and Aptos collectively and not a single dedicated one yet in our town, amazingly. I began seeking to manifest this project in earnest last year, and have met with so much enthusiasm, synchronicity and support of all across the community, in unfolding this vision to this point. Everywhere, there is tremendous energy supporting the transformation of our downtown Watsonville area into a more visible, healthy and vibrant community for people of all ages and backgrounds.

We have gained a lease on a wonderful historic building at 375 N. Main Street, across from the beautiful community Plaza in the heart of downtown. It comes with some revitalization work to be sure, which forms part of the need-basis for this campaign: the building needs a new ADA bathroom downstairs, and new Title 24 electrical throughout the building, a $50000 price tag in addition to our other build-out, start-up and staffing costs.

Our Yoga studio, named Watsonville Yoga, Dance and Healing Arts, comes to downtown at a time ripe with anticipation and a warmly extended invitation by the City for change and progress specific to the downtown area. This change, so long in coming, could only be of the kind that reflects the unique cultural identity of Watsonville and its’ people.

I have been touched over and over by the kindness in our community, and the defining spirit that of value on the family/familia: from parents I speak to in the parks while our children play, to the gentle abuelas and abuelos who stop to interact with my children, give them treats, and touch their heads with a smile. It is because of the richness I feel here that I want to be able to give back to our community in this project, our own much needed dedicated Yoga studio and world dance studio-- with bilingual classes to connect the community inclusively to the creative, peace-of-mind-enhancing and socially uniting practices of Yoga along with the joy and cultural traditions of world dance taught by leading teachers in their art.

I have, in the past, taught bilingual Yoga classes in Watsonville and Aptos at various Mid Pen Housing sites for a largely migrant population, who I grew to know intimately. I primarily served the communities at these sites with academic tutoring, but I also orchestrated meetings with indigenous teachers for the children and adult residents of the community. I gained footing in bilingual skills thanks largely to the patience of this community of people who lovingly encouraged me. Part of the vision for this studio comes from the positive memory of the reception to those Yoga classes
column2:
how useful they were for the people doing backbreaking work in the fields, and the joy that children and young teens found in creative movement through Yoga.

Through my husband Tom May’s employment as a Science teacher at PV High and his work with youth leadership and ecology with WATCH / Monterey Bay Aquarium, I have also learned much about the needs of families in our town for healthy, culturally-grounded leadership opportunities for our youth, and the positive impact it returns to their families and to the relationship to the land which we all depend upon, live and work with as well.

I believe with all of my heart, likewise, in the capacity of Yoga to reveal the above qualities in a person. Cesar Chavez did too--he studied and took example from Yoga philosophy at the observation of “Mahatma” Mohandas K. Gandhi’s successful independence movement for India out of British colonial rule, and the improvements for the people which followed on personal and economic levels.

Watsonville Yoga, Dance and Healing Arts will both reflect the existing cultural heritages in Watsonville and continue to reach across cultures beyond our area in many ways. Yoga is steeped in it’s own culture from hereditary India, but is now practiced all over the world. The dance classes we will offer will be varied world dance taught by teachers who have lived in or studied at their artistic place of origin and are fluent in the language and indigenous musical traditions which stand beside the dance. Dance can be entertaining but has great personal value also as a cultural expression and personal means for joy, energy, discipline, and health. We have plans for ""Worldanz"" hip hop and global fusion for kids and adults, Middle Eastern / North African Bellydance, Brasilian Capoeira and Samba, and Ballet Folklorico, and are in the process of securing Mejica / Aztec dance and Salsa.

Yoga classes will be offered to everyone inclusively, with mostly bilingual teachers and a bilingual receptionist at the desk at all times. We will offer classes for every age, physical ability, and stylistic preference. Our staff and teachers are sought locally first.

Our tentative Yoga schedule includes classes in meditation, Iyengar-inspired Hatha Yoga, Hatha Yoga, Sivananda Yoga, Vinyasa Flow, Yin/ Restorative, Yoga for kids, and a Community by-donation class for the general public and one for Seniors.

We will also be partnering with local acupuncturists and massage therapists to have a wellness center during the low-use times in the studio.

Watsonville Yoga, Dance and Healing Arts will improve the quality of life for our community in so many ways. Be a part of the positive change and show your support by pre-purchasing a monthly pass at this discounted rate of $50 or simply making a donation! Thank you from our hearts for donating, and for helping us to by spreading the word! Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools on this site!


","In our first run, our campaign raised $2789 through the generosity of 45 backers! Thanks for your community-minded consideration in helping us fund the build-out and staffing of a first-of-its’ kind, bilingual Yoga studio with world dance and an in-house healing arts clinic for Watsonville and its’ surrounds! With your donation of over $50, you become a valued supporter of positive change in Watsonville, and one of our first and honored guests at the studio when we open in July, with an unlimited monthly pass! If you don't live in Watsonville, you can donate it to a designated friend or family member. There are at least 16 Yoga studios in Santa Cruz, Capitola, and Aptos collectively and not a single dedicated one yet in our town, amazingly. I began seeking to manifest this project in earnest last year, and have met with so much enthusiasm, synchronicity and support of all across the community, in unfolding this vision to this point. Everywhere, there is tremendous energy supporting the transformation of our downtown Watsonville area into a more visible, healthy and vibrant community for people of all ages and backgrounds.We have gained a lease on a wonderful historic building at 375 N. Main Street, across from the beautiful community Plaza in the heart of downtown. It comes with some revitalization work to be sure, which forms part of the need-basis for this campaign: the building needs a new ADA bathroom downstairs, and new Title 24 electrical throughout the building, a $50000 price tag in addition to our other build-out, start-up and staffing costs.Our Yoga studio, named Watsonville Yoga, Dance and Healing Arts, comes to downtown at a time ripe with anticipation and a warmly extended invitation by the City for change and progress specific to the downtown area. This change, so long in coming, could only be of the kind that reflects the unique cultural identity of Watsonville and its’ people.I have been touched over and over by the kindness in our community, and the defining spirit that of value on the family/familia: from parents I speak to in the parks while our children play, to the gentle abuelas and abuelos who stop to interact with my children, give them treats, and touch their heads with a smile. It is because of the richness I feel here that I want to be able to give back to our community in this project, our own much needed dedicated Yoga studio and world dance studio-- with bilingual classes to connect the community inclusively to the creative, peace-of-mind-enhancing and socially uniting practices of Yoga along with the joy and cultural traditions of world dance taught by leading teachers in their art.I have, in the past, taught bilingual Yoga classes in Watsonville and Aptos at various Mid Pen Housing sites for a largely migrant population, who I grew to know intimately. Part of the vision for this studio comes from the positive memory of the reception to those Yoga classes

So, Here's the Story.  There's Always a Story.

I LOVE Stories!

I’m Sharon Klinger and I developed Heavy Metal Rollerz. I am very excited about Heavy Metal Rollerz, which is a new line of massage rollers, the Weighted Massage Roller.  Heavy Metal Rollerz is a uniquely designed solid stainless steel massage roller. I developed this roller to effectively, efficiently and independently target the trapezius muscles (I call it the Trapz Rollerz) as I found no other device to effectively target this area. Most massage rollers are made of foam and use your body weight to maneuver on the roller to get relief.  This can be ineffective and awkward for the trapezius and forearms.  With Heavy Metal Rollerz, the weight of the roller does the work, especially the muscles of the trapezius (Trapz Rollerz), forearms (Forearmz Rollerz) and quadriceps (Quadz Rollerz).

I have over the years suffered from many aches and pains specifically in my trapezius which causes headaches for me.  I go to the massage therapist monthly to get a massage as prevention, which is wonderful, however in between visits it was difficult to take care of this area and the visits can get expensive and be time consuming.  (She does this thing with my trapezius where she pushes her thumbs into my muscles-it's awesome- and I wanted to be able to mimic this).  At the gym that I attend, I was first introduced to using a 30-45 pound barbell to massage the quadriceps and trapezius independently, and the hamstring and calves with a partner and introduced to the concept of ""Myofascial Release"".  With using the barbell however, it was difficult to maneuver and not everyone has a barbell and partner at home.  Lacrosse balls can also be used however you must put yourself in some precarious positions.   I then thought to myself, ""Doesn't anyone simply sell the end of the barbell?"" (that's all you need).  I then researched the market and the answer was 'No', so I sought out to develop it and Heavy Metal Rollerz was born.  

I have always been athletic and involved in sports in some aspect starting with gymnastics at the age of 6 and now participating in Crossfit at the age of 48 for the past 3 years and I love it!  I  love being active and my goal is to stay fit and healthy as long as possible, enjoy life, and keep up with my active 4 children, who are now adults.  I want my children to enjoy life and not have to worry about taking care of me. 

My expertise includes a lifetime of sports and physical activity  including gymnastics (my true love) swimming and diving, cheerleading, dance, basketball, track and field, softball, and many other adult fitness activities such as traditional aerobics and strength training.  I also hold a Bachelors degree in Health and Physical Education, Associates Degree in Business Administration, and Masters degrees Counseling Psychology and Secondary School Counseling along with numerous Fitness certifications through American Aerobic Association International (AAAI) and Athletics and Fitness Association of America (AFAA).  

What We Need From You!

Contributing to Heavy Metal Rollerz will help me achieve assisting with increasing overall wellness of fitness enthusiasts while decreasing overall muscle tension and improving muscle performance.  It will assist with my first line of production costs, advertising and patent application.  I chose a stainless steel product as it is the best quality steel with the least side effects.  Carbon steel will rust and chemical coatings eventually come off (although I was told it would not).  Many people have skin allergies which I want to keep the product chemical free and user friendly.  I also chose to proudly make Heavy Metal Rollerz in the USA keeping USA jobs alive!  I currently have been granted a United States Provisional Utility Patent which is due to expire soon and I need to file a non-provisional patent. I would like to also file for a design patent at the suggestion of my attorney.  I also plan to donate a portion of sales to a non-profit organization that I will create to assist with underprivileged children in our community to join community activities and sports.  I feel that community involvement is an integral part of a childhood to get involved and stay healthy, both physically and mentally.  I have been working with underprivileged children with Mental Health diagnoses, especially Autism, for the past 15 years.  My goal is to have people share my results and relief with using Heavy Metal Rollerz.  My muscles feel better, I perform better, my muscles are more flexible, and my headaches are minimal.  

So Where Does Your Contribution Go Exactly?

Costs for Heavy Metal Rollerz include $24,000 for the first round of manufacturing for the 15 pound roller, 'Trapz Rollerz' which the more that is made, the cheaper the cost to the buyer (The Trapz Rollerz design is finalized and the manufacturer is secured and awaiting my call)
column2: $4,750 for a mold for the bumpy roller 'Quadz Rollerz' which can make 10, 15 and 20 pound rollers (The pattern shop is secured, however we are finalizing the design)
column4: $10,000 to file for a non-provisional United States utility patent
column5: $3,000 to file for a design patent
column7:
$5,000 for upcoming trade and fitness expositions.  I am currently operating out of my house and intend to keep it there as long as possible to keep costs low to the buyer.  I am looking to make each of the rollers 'Trapz Rollerz, Forearmz Rollerz, and Quadz Rollerz' in 10, 15 and 20 pound weights. 

What You Get

I would like to offer perks for people to experience Heavy Metal Rollerz first.  This includes a reduced cost to the contributor getting one 15 pound Heavy Metal Rollerz  ""Trapz Rollerz"".  

If funds aren't totally raised, the funds raised will be used to the first round of manufacturing first, then to advertising and expositions, and lastly patent.  

The Impact

I feel that my project will be an asset form any fitness enthusiast to professional athlete.  Heavy Metal Rollerz provides athletes with an effective alternative to typical massage rollers that can be used inexpensively and independently and gives great relief to its users.  With my contributing a portion of the proceeds to underprivileged children, this can give the children and families something to look forward to that they enjoy.  I love to see children's smiling faces when they are having fun.  It will give them a place to go where they can be happy and have fun.  Many of these children and families have day to day struggles which are out of their control.  I also made it a point to keep Heavy Metal Rollerz production in the United States to assist with maintaining USA employment.  Although it may be minimal, it does make a difference. 

 And here's a little bit more about me.  

Over the years, I have always enjoyed working with people and giving them assistance in many different ways.  I feel happy simply to help someone out.  Also, when I put my mind to something, I will do it.  I am very frivolous when it comes to spending money.  I saved money by doing mostly everything myself or seeking help from people that I know.  I am now a photographer, videographer, and video editor, and am improving with my skills daily!  Also to save money, I talked to different attorneys getting opinions at minimal costs, using a retired attorney, a Wilkes University Allan P. Kirby Center for Free Enterprise and Entrepreneurship attorney, local SCORE chapter attorney and consulted with other attorneys for FREE.  I am also very time conscious.  I don’t like to waste it!  I work efficiently and effectively to get the most out of the day.

When I was younger, around age 6, my oldest sister introduced me to gymnastics.  She saw a talent in me and helped me improve it.  Gymnastics was my sanity as a child as my childhood was a bit difficult and stressful to say the least.  I could certainly say that Gymnastics 'saved me'.  Athletics have always been a part of my life and I simply love participating in them.  I love the way I feel when I am doing any physical activity, I strengthen my muscles, heart and lungs, and it is a great coping skill and stress reducer.  There are so many healthful benefits of exercise.  Over the years, I have had aches and pains which at times prohibited me with participating in once enjoyable physical activities.  When I was introduced to massage rolling and really taking care of my muscles at the age of 45, I have never felt better.  I want to share my success and let others get the benefits of a healthy body from using Heavy Metal Rollerz. 

                                                

Risks &
column8:
Challenges

Coming from a hard working family, I was taught that hard work and persistence with pay off in the end.  Both of my parents grew up in poor families.  My mother at age 16 worked in a shirt factory until her retirement and my father was a member of the United States Army, worked in the coal mines and then a steel factory until his retirement.  They showed me how to work hard to get what you want and that hard work was a priority.  They worked very hard to support their family and give us what they didn’t have and to live an easier life than they had in their childhood.  They taught me how to work to make a living and how to make a difference by being kind and helpful to others.   Although my parents were educated to some of High School (later a GED in her retirement-Go Mom!) and a High School graduate (Go Dad!), they encouraged me to further my education which gave me a drive for learning (and I DID NOT want to work in a factory-I saw their pains and struggles with this).  I consistently am looking to learn something that I do not know.  If I need to know something or don't know something, I seek to find it until I do.   I am the type of person that will persist to find a solution to a problem.   I am always open to learn new skills and information.  I enjoy learning and helping others.  I dedicate Heavy Metal Rollerz to my parents with having a 'Z' which is the first letter in their last name. 

                                               

Some challenges that I may face is Heavy Metal Rollerz will be a unique new product line.  There may be some difficulty with introducing it and getting the name out there.  However, there are currently many new muscle manipulation modalities being introduced often and based on those modalities ""Myofascial Release"", this product should be a hit!  Currently the only obstacle for me with starting the sell this product is time and money.  I work full time currently and it proves difficult to get things done efficiently. I am trying to keep costs low, so I am doing most of the leg work myself without hiring others for anything unless absolutely necessary.

In order to assist with implementing the Weighted Massage Roller concept using Heavy Metal Rollerz, I plan on initially advertising in different magazines that target sports enthusiasts, and Social Media of course.  These athletes are already using new advanced modalities and Heavy Metal Rollerz will be another device that can be used effectively. 

So What's This About Myofascial Release

""Fascia"" is soft connective tissue located beneath the skin.  It wraps and connects the muscles, bones, nerves and blood vessels of the body.  Together muscle and fascia make up the myofascial system.  This fascia can get 'stuck' together which is called an 'adhesion' resulting in restricted muscle movement, and causing pain and soreness.  This can be caused from not using the muscles, not enough stretching, injuries or overusing the muscles.  

""Myofascial Release"" in simple terms refers to loosening tight muscles.  This technique results in the softening and lengthening of the fascia and breaking down adhesions.  This technique includes applying pressure to the muscles to release lactic acid build up which causes 'tightness'.  This can be accomplished by a) using a Massage Therapist (which costs a bit of money, appointment times are needed taking away from our busy schedules and lives), b) using a foam roller (which can be clumsy and ineffective especially for the trapezius and is ineffective for the forearms), c) using a muscle stimulator (which involves electrical stimulation) or d) using a weighted object (enter Heavy Metal Rollerz).  

Benefits of Myofascial Release to the muscles includes:  Reducing Soreness, Reducing Tightness, Increasing Flexibility, Improving Mobility, Improving Range of Motion, Helps Prevent Injuries by Correcting Imbalances, Reducing Tension, and Helps De-stress and relax (it does wonders to reduce headaches for me!)

Timeline and Product Development-The Fun Part!

Well, what I whirlwind this has been.  Seek and ye shall find.....and a lot of persistence and patience!

September 2013-Began my new adventures in 'Functional Fitness' training and introduced to the concept of foam rolling, Myofascial Release, and later weighted rolling with a barbell and other implements.

Time goes by and I am mulling over the thought of having a device that I can use myself as an independent effective massage technique, especially for the trapezius.  Again my massage therapist does this thing with simply pushing her thumbs into my trapezius.  I can feel the release going into my head and down my arms.  I really wanted to mimic this movement. Somewhere during this time, we were introduced to putting a 30-45 pound barbell on our trapezius.  Well that felt pretty good, but very awkward.  A spark goes off and I simply thought to use the weighted end of the barbell.
column10: '>January 2015-Totally by chance at the right place and the right time, I am talking to a Computer Aided Design Teacher at a local school about what I am trying to find and make.  He is able to show me and tell me about making plastic prototypes and where I can get one done!
column11: >I now simply needed a solid metal 1 foot bar.  I then contacted the companies who make barbells to see if such a thing exists.  It didn't!  ""Now where do I find such a thing?""  Not so simple.   Well I started with a recycling center and looked around the scrap yard and found a few steel bars but not what I was looking for.  They gave me a contact as a starting
column12:
> point and I began calling any place that may sell something like it and finally found a supplier of steel bars!  Success!  

March 2015-After researching local technical schools in the area, I found one that could make me a plastic prototype for FREE!
column14: '> I then contacted every machine shop in the area (pretty much!) and found one that could machine my steel bar into the plastic design.
column16: > was to get the price much cheaper!
column18: '>August 2015- Again, by chance, I hear an advertisement for Inventions Home with regard to patenting an idea.  (Interestingly, I don't hear that commercial now), So I had a patent search completed and filed and was granted a United States Provisional Patent for one year.
column20: '>October 2015- Again by chance, I hear of our local SCORE chapter for new businesses began holding information sessions about opening a new business.  I attended these sessions over the next few months being introduced to Wilkes University's business assistance program.
column23: >- Over the year, I called and visited and researched other machine shops, along with steel foundries to do another design, and finally found a reasonable machine shop who does excellent quality work to manufacture the roller.  Whew, that was really tough!  I also had several other prototypes made in plastic and steel during this time.  I also contacted powder and other coating companies to try this as a cheaper option.  Cheaper isn't always better.  No coating that I tried actually
column24: > stayed on.  I had a few different prototypes made at a local machine shop and brought them to the gym for testing...Success.  Everyone who tried it gave positive feedback.
column28: > Showcase as I began working with
column29: > them through our local SCORE chapter.   All positive feedback was given!
column32: >October 2106-Heavy Metal Rollerz will be ready for production and sales.
column33: >Thank you for your interest in Heavy Metal Rollerz. I hope you enjoy them as much as I do!
column34: >Even if you are not interested for yourself, you may know someone who is!
column35: >You can certainly donate anyway. Any amount will be helpful and greatly appreciated!
column36:
>Please SHARE with your friends!

Kirby Center for Free Enterprise and Entrepreneurship attorney, local SCORE chapter attorney and consulted with other attorneys for FREE.  I am also very time conscious.  I don’t like to waste it!  I work efficiently and effectively to get the most out of the day.When I was younger, around age 6, my oldest sister introduced me to gymnastics.  She saw a talent in me and helped me improve it.  Gymnastics was my sanity as a child as my childhood was a bit difficult and stressful to say the least.  I could certainly say that Gymnastics 'saved me'.  Athletics have always been a part of my life and I simply love participating in them.  I love the way I feel when I am doing any physical activity, I strengthen my muscles, heart and lungs, and it is a great coping skill and stress reducer.  There are so many healthful benefits of exercise.  Over the years, I have had aches and pains which at times prohibited me with participating in once enjoyable physical activities.  When I was introduced to massage rolling and really taking care of my muscles at the age of 45, I have never felt better.  I want to share my success and let others get the benefits of a healthy body from using Heavy Metal Rollerz.                                                 Risks & ChallengesComing from a hard working family, I was taught that hard work and persistence with pay off in the end.  Both of my parents grew up in poor families.  My mother at age 16 worked in a shirt factory until her retirement and my father was a member of the United States Army, worked in the coal mines and then a steel factory until his retirement.  They showed me how to work hard to get what you want and that hard work was a priority.  They worked very hard to support their family and give us what they didn’t have and to live an easier life than they had in their childhood.  They taught me how to work to make a living and how to make a difference by being kind and helpful to others.   Although my parents were educated to some of High School (later a GED in her retirement-Go Mom!) and a High School graduate (Go Dad!), they encouraged me to further my education which gave me a drive for learning (and I DID NOT want to work in a factory-I saw their pains and struggles with this).  I consistently am looking to learn something that I do not know.  If I need to know something or don't know something, I seek to find it until I do.   I am the type of person that will persist to find a solution to a problem.   I am always open to learn new skills and information.  I enjoy learning and helping others.  I dedicate Heavy Metal Rollerz to my parents with having a 'Z' which is the first letter in their last name.                                                Some challenges that I may face is Heavy Metal Rollerz will be a unique new product line.  There may be some difficulty with introducing it and getting the name out there.  However, there are currently many new muscle manipulation modalities being introduced often and based on those modalities ""Myofascial Release"", this product should be a hit!  Currently the only obstacle for me with starting the sell this product is time and money.  I work full time currently and it proves difficult to get things done efficiently. I am trying to keep costs low, so I am doing most of the leg work myself without hiring others for anything unless absolutely necessary.In order to assist with implementing the Weighted Massage Roller concept using Heavy Metal Rollerz, I plan on initially advertising in different magazines that target sports enthusiasts, and Social Media of course.  These athletes are already using new advanced modalities and Heavy Metal Rollerz will be another device that can be used effectively. So What's This About Myofascial Release""Fascia"" is soft connective tissue located beneath the skin.  It wraps and connects the muscles, bones, nerves and blood vessels of the body.  Together muscle and fascia make up the myofascial system.  This fascia can get 'stuck' together which is called an 'adhesion' resulting in restricted muscle movement, and causing pain and soreness.  This can be caused from not using the muscles, not enough stretching, injuries or overusing the muscles.  ""Myofascial Release"" in simple terms refers to loosening tight muscles.  This technique results in the softening and lengthening of the fascia and breaking down adhesions.  This technique includes applying pressure to the muscles to release lactic acid build up which causes 'tightness'.  This can be accomplished by a) using a Massage Therapist (which costs a bit of money, appointment times are needed taking away from our busy schedules and lives), b) using a foam roller (which can be clumsy and ineffective especially for the trapezius and is ineffective for the forearms), c) using a muscle stimulator (which involves electrical stimulation) or d) using a weighted object (enter Heavy Metal Rollerz).  Benefits of Myofascial Release to the muscles includes:  Reducing Soreness, Reducing Tightness, Increasing Flexibility, Improving Mobility, Improving Range of Motion, Helps Prevent Injuries by Correcting Imbalances, Reducing Tension, and Helps De-stress and relax (it does wonders to reduce headaches for me!)Timeline and Product Development-The Fun Part!Well, what I whirlwind this has been.  Seek and ye shall find.....and a lot of persistence and patience!September 2013-Began my new adventures in 'Functional Fitness' training and introduced to the concept of foam rolling, Myofascial Release, and later weighted rolling with a barbell and other implements.Time goes by and I am mulling over the thought of having a device that I can use myself as an independent effective massage technique, especially for the trapezius.  Again my massage therapist does this thing with simply pushing her thumbs into my trapezius.  I can feel the release going into my head and down my arms.  I really wanted to mimic this movement. Somewhere during this time, we were introduced to putting a 30-45 pound barbell on our trapezius.  Well that felt pretty good, but very awkward.  A spark goes off and I simply thought to use the weighted end of the barbell.  January 2015-Totally by chance at the right place and the right time, I am talking to a Computer Aided Design Teacher at a local school about what I am trying to find and make.  He is able to show me and tell me about making plastic prototypes and where I can get one done!  I now simply needed a solid metal 1 foot bar.  I then contacted the companies who make barbells to see if such a thing exists.  It didn't!  ""Now where do I find such a thing?""  Not so simple.   Well I started with a recycling center and looked around the scrap yard and found a few steel bars but not what I was looking for.  They gave me a contact as a starting point and I began calling any place that may sell something like it and finally found a supplier of steel bars!  Success!  March 2015-After researching local technical schools in the area, I found one that could make me a plastic prototype for FREE!  I then contacted every machine shop in the area (pretty much!) and found one that could machine my steel bar into the plastic design.  My goal however was to get the price much cheaper!  August 2015- Again, by chance, I hear an advertisement for Inventions Home with regard to patenting an idea.  (Interestingly, I don't hear that commercial now), So I had a patent search completed and filed and was granted a United States Provisional Patent for one year. October 2015- Again by chance, I hear of our local SCORE chapter for new businesses began holding information sessions about opening a new business.  I attended these sessions over the next few months being introduced to Wilkes University's business assistance program.   March 2016 - Over the year, I called and visited and researched other machine shops, along with steel foundries to do another design, and finally found a reasonable machine shop who does excellent quality work to manufacture the roller.  Whew, that was really tough!  I also had several other prototypes made in plastic and steel during this time.  I also contacted powder and other coating companies to try this as a cheaper option.  Cheaper isn't always better.  No coating that I tried actually stayed on.  I had a few different prototypes made at a local machine shop and brought them to the gym for testing...Success.  Everyone who tried it gave positive feedback.  April 2016-I was asked by Wilkes University to take part in their Entrepreneur Showcase as I began working with them through our local SCORE chapter.   All positive feedback was given!August 2016-Indiegogo campaign launchOctober 2106-Heavy Metal Rollerz will be ready for production and sales.  Thank you for your interest in Heavy Metal Rollerz. I hope you enjoy them as much as I do!Even if you are not interested for yourself, you may know someone who is!  You can certainly donate anyway. Any amount will be helpful and greatly appreciated!Please SHARE with your friends!",4.0,0,"1 Campaign
